texts.es: El Grupo “Kori Inti” esta representado por la señora Pamela y conformado por 10 miembros de las cuales 8 son mujeres y dos varones son un grupo alegre y con muchas expectativas de crecimiento. La señora Pamela es casada y tiene dos niños que sustentar y los cuales son su razón para seguir adelante, su esposo es de profesión constructor pero en estos momentos se encuentra imposibilitado de poder trabajar temporalmente, pero mientras tanto la señora pamela sostiene el hogar con su pequeño puesto de venta de pasteles y masitas las cuales reparte a colegios y puestos de venta de dulces, ella es una persona muy positiva y sabe que podrá sacar adelante a su familia brindándoles una buena educación a sus hijos y un hogar propio para su familia. El resto de las socias se dedica a la venta y comercialización de artesanías, costura, repostería y venta de comida. En el mercado donde elaboran sus actividades las señoras, existe bastante competencia sin embargo ellas se valen de la rapidez que tienen para cambiar y surtir sus mercaderías siempre están de acuerdo al comportamiento del mercado y de las exigencias de la temporada. El destino del crédito es principalmente para el incremento de su capital de trabajo, para que de aquí a un futuro no muy lejano puedan tener un puesto fijo y un ingreso permanente .La mayoría de las socias tienen experiencia crediticia ya que van cursando ya un segundo ciclo dentro de la institución y saben muy bien como manejar su capital y administrar bien sus fondos.
texts.en:
The Kor Inti Group, represented by Ms. Pamela, is comprised of 10 members--8 women and 2 men. It is a very joyful group that expects to grow. Ms. Pamela is married and has two children to support, which is her reason to get ahead in life. Her husband is a builder, but at this time he is temporarily unable to work. In the meantime, Ms. Pamela has to support the family with her small pastry stand, delivering her goods to schools and candy stands. She is a very positive person who will be able to help her family move forward by providing her children with a home and a good education. The other group members either sell handicrafts, baked goods, fast food, or they sew clothing for a living. There exists a lot of competition at the market where the members work, but they have an edge in the speed at which they can rotate and stock up on their goods. They always follow the market rules and meet seasonal demands. This loan will primarily be used as working capital so that they can have their own fixed stand and a steady income in the not-so-distant future. The majority of the group members have experience working with microfinance institutes as they are currently in their second loan cycle with us, so they know how to manage their capital and funds well.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana tiene 39 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos. Vive con su familia en su casa propia en un hermoso valle de una comunidad llamada “Zorza”. 

Apenas nació su primer hijo, Juliana conjuntamente con su esposo decidieron que era tiempo de emprender un proyecto de negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. Ya lleva 15 años trabajando en su tienda de abarrotes, donde recibe la ayuda de sus hijos en tiempo de vacaciones. En suma, su negocio le es muy rentable, ya que puede llevar felicidad a su familia y desterrar futuras preocupaciones económicas. En el futuro piensa ampliar su bodega, adquiriendo nuevos productos con los que espera atraer nuevos clientes.

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y hace hincapié en seguir cumpliendo con sus cuotas establecidas, además honra bondades a su banco Comunal, puesto que todos son responsables y puntuales. Con el dinero solicitado podrá aumentar la cantidad de productos que más le solicitan y comprar unos nuevos para incrementar su clientela.
texts.en:
Juliana is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. She and her family own their home and live in a beautiful valley in a community called Zorza. Just after their first child was born, Juliana and her husband decided it was time to start a business to improve their quality of life. It has been 15 years since they opened their grocery store. The children help out in the store during their breaks from school. Overall, the business is profitable; their family is happy and they are able to dismiss financial concerns for the future. In the future, Juliana wants to expand the store, stocking new products that she hopes will attract new customers. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she emphasizes that she will continue to meet her scheduled payments, while honoring the kindness of the other members of her community bank, who are responsible and punctual in their loan repayment. With the requested funding Juliana will be able to increase inventory of products in high demand, as well as purchase new products to bring new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Mirna Apariza

texts.es: Mirna Apariza tiene 59 años, su negocio que es la compra y venta de ropa Inició su negocio hace mas de 4 años, pues siempre le ha gustado salir adelante, los créditos en la Fundación le han ayudado a cambiar su vida porque con ellos ha logrado incrementar las ventas. Ella quiere seguir ampliándolo, sueña con tener un local propio por lo que así sus clientes la visitarían y tendría nuevas posibilidades. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de trajes, camisetas, ropa interior y pantalones.
texts.en:
Mirna Apariza, age 59, has a business buying and selling clothing. She began this business more than 4 years ago because she has always liked getting ahead. Loans with the Foundation have helped change her life because they have succeeded in allowing her to increase sales. She wants to continue growing. She dreams of having her own shop for her customers to visit and in order to have new possibilities for her business. The loan she is applying for is for working capital so that she can purchase suits, T-shirts, underwear and trousers.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ilsan

texts.en:
Ilsan is a 35-year-old married man from South Cotabato. He has a 5-year-old child whom he dreams will have a bright future.

Ilsan farms for a living and also sells herbal medicines. He says that he wants to focus on selling herbal medicines because it is in high demand right now in his location.

Ilsan hopes to prosper in what he does. He applied for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI which he will use to buy farm inputs and also to increase his capital for his herbal medicine business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and to use as additional capital for his herbal medicine business

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely P. is from the village of Cabol-Anonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Fely is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Fely owns & operates a business venture selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to local community members. Fely has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fely is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Fely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Edgard Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Edgar Antonio B. G., vive acompañado de su pareja de vida y su hijo de 2 años en el Barrio Raúl Roja,  él labora como maestro de obra siendo este la principal fuente de ingresos familiar. Su esposa realiza las labores domesticas.

El ha tenido desde hace mucho tiempo atrás, tiene problemas con el sistema eléctrico de su hogar y es por esta razón solita un préstamo para la compra de matariles eléctricos que le permitan realizar las reparaciones necesarias para el bien de los miembros de su hogar, debido a que un cortocircuito amenaza con la seguridad de la familia y la pérdida del hogar, ya que amenaza una amenaza de incendio se encuentra latente de no haber una reparación rápida.
texts.en:
Edgar Antonio B. G. lives with his life partner and their two year old son in the Raúl Roja neighborhood. He works as a master builder, and this is the primary source of income for the family. His wife does domestic work. For a long time he has had problems with the electrical system in his house. That is why he is requesting a loan to buy electric materials, which will allow him to make the necessary repairs. This is for the good of the members of his household because a short circuit threatens the safety of his family and the loss of his home. There is a potential threat of fire if the repairs are not done quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the electrical system in his house

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P. is from the village of Ramon Magsaysay, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 33 years old and married with no children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a general store. The other source of income for the family comes primarily from the income of her husband as a machine operator. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
       
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
 
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
M. Ilhomjon is married. His wife is a homemaker and they have two children. He has always been a hard worker, someone who started at an early age helping his mother with her clothing business and contributing his earnings to the family from the time he was young. When Ilhomjon married, his expenses increased and he had to strike out on his own to build a business that would support his own family. With the help of his father, he started a clothing-sales business and his wife helped him. His business has grown and he wants to continue to grow in order to improve his quality of life. He is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni to buy more merchandise for his business. Ilhomjon and his family are very grateful for the support you are providing to help them get ahead.  
   
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Buying new clothing to sell

loans.name: Eutropia Teodosia

texts.es:
Eutropia perteneces al Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua, y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro porque en casa no podía ahorrar.
Eutropia es casada y tiene 3 hijo que estudian, Eutropia viaja a dos ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada, viaja los días sábados y regresa los días miércoles a la provincia de Vilcas Huaman. Además Eutropia junto a su esposo tienen un carro que realiza transporte interprovincial. Eutropia solicita un préstamo de 2400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, buzo, medias.
Los sueños de Eutropia son comprar otro carro, construir el tercer piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Eutropia belongs to the Kusikuy Communal Bank. Kusikuy means Be Happy in Quechau. What she likes the best is the incentive to save because she could not save at home. Eutropia is married and has three children who go to school. Eutropia travels to two regional fairs where they sell various articles of clothing. She travels on Saturdays and returns to the Vilcas Huaman province on Wednesdays. Also, Eutropia and her husband have a car, which is used for inter-provincial transportation. Eutropia is requesting a loan for 2,400 soles to buy sweaters, sweatshirts, and socks. Eutropia’s dreams are to buy another car and to build a third floor on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters, sweatshirts, and socks

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 27 years old and single. Clarisse lives with her parents, where she has some responsibilities at home. Clarisse has to contribute in her family to provide all their needs. Clarisse owns a business selling eggs. This business is profitable. Clarisse works hard and she works every day except on Saturday.

Clarisse is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing large quantities of eggs. With this loan, Clarisse will be able to earn more profit, which will allow her to save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of eggs

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina M. is from the village of Allinguigan 3rd. She is 43 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. Martina owns and operates a specialized retail store which sells clothing products in the local community. Martina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years.

In 2009, Martina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Martina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Martina is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase more inventory. This loan will be the 4rth loan taken out by Martina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Salomon Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 44 años de edad, el se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en su unidad, una mototaxi que adquirió con sus ahorros de trabajos anteriores, actualmente este negocio le brinda buenas ganancias que le permiten sostener a su familia, el tiene ya dos años trabajando en su unidad, solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo, se le otorga el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Daniel is 44 years old, and he provides transportation services with his vehicle, a mototaxi (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle) that he acquired through his savings from a previous job. Now this business provides good earnings that allow him to support his family. He has now worked for 2 years with his vehicle, and he is requesting a loan to do maintenance work on it. He has been granted this loan based on his good personal references and his ability to pay.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: maintenance for his mototaxi

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia A. is from the barangay of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old and a widow. To make a living, she is engaged in dressmaking and making curtains, embroideries and house decorations. She also receives regular monthly support from her son, who is presently working as a nurse. Virginia has been engaged in this business for 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from this business activity.
In 2007, Virginia joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program and has successfully repaid a loan of 25,000 PHP. She is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP as her seventh loan, which will be used as financial assistance for her son’s wedding.
Virginia plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansion.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as financial assistance for her son's wedding

loans.name: Rosaleo

texts.en:
Rosaleo C. is from the town of Talibon. He is 39 years old. Rosaleo is married and has 4 children. His eldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 12. To make a living, Rosaleo owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. 

Rosaleo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosaleo has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosaleo is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Estela Mariaca

texts.es: Estela Maria tiene 45 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio en una tienda. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, siempre ha sido una madre responsable con sus dos hijos que son menores de edad. Inicio este negocio por la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingresos para su hogar ella es una madre responsable y trabajadora y que disfruta mucho de  su trabajo al interactuar con sus clientes. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como ropa, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida su familia.
texts.en: Estela Maria is 45 years old.  Her economic activity is offering the service of a store. She has worked in this business for more than 16 years. She has always been a responsible mother with her 2 minor children, She started this this business out of need to look a source of income for her home. She is a responsible and hard-working woman who who really enjoys her work when interacting with her customers. This loan is to buy materials such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and sheets, among other things. She dreams of improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Candida

texts.es: Candida M. D. E. D. 45 años D. edad, vive junto a tres hijos, los cuales dependen por completo D. ella, debido a que Candida es madre soltera, junto a ellos resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee un ciber café, en el cual brinda el servicio D. Internet y así mismo comercializa otros artículos como: cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, diferentes tipos D. papelería, CD’s y otros más. En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos, D. modo que todos trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante su hogar. Candida solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. mejorar su servicio, comprando productos como: audífonos, cámaras web, nuevos monitores, parlantes y otros accesorios muy útiles y necesarios para las computadoras que él alquila. D. esta forma Candida desea ir creciendo más y más y así contar con un negocio muy estable, el cual le brinD. una mejor estabilidad económica para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Candida M. D. E. is 45 years old and lives with her three children, all of whom are dependent on her. She is a single mother and lives with her family in the Department of San Salvador. Candida manages a cybercafé where she provides Internet services and sells merchandise such as notebooks, pencils, pens, different types of stationery, CDs, and other items. Her business allows her to help her children, since they all work hard to get ahead.

Candida is requesting a loan because she wants to improve her service. She plans to buy headphones, web cameras, new monitors, speakers, and other needed accessories for the computers she makes available for rent. Candida wants to keep growing so that she will have a stable business, which will help her proviD. better financial stability for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase computer accessories

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda R. is from the village of Locsoon Tudela Misamis occidental. She is 34 years old. Creselda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Creselda owns and operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Creselda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Creselda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Creselda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Creselda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Creselda from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
50-year-old Marilou C. is from the town of Santo Niño. She is married and has 6 children. Her eldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is 15. Three of her children still go to school and Marilou works hard to sustain their education.  

Marilou is involved in rice farming. She has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than a few years now. She always aims to increase her harvest so that she would also earn more.

Marilou joined CEVI to gain access to financial services. She finds it very useful and hopes the MFI will expand and serve more farmers like her. She applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. This loan will be very helpful to Marilou's farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Love

texts.en:
A known quote says, "In every cloud there is a silver lining". Love D., 34, believes life to be so. Love reached college and is married to Richard; together, they have three children, two of whom are in elementary school, while the third one is not yet of school age.  They presently live in Caloocan City, Philippines.

Love is in the direct--sales business. She sells silver accessories like necklaces, earrings, and rings to friends, neighbors, and business connections. Being eight years in business, Love uses knowledge based on experience and applies her learning from training in CCT* to make her business grow. Every month she earns around Php 8,250.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She intends to use this money to buy more silver accessories as well as products from the well-known beauty brand AVON in order to give her customers more options. She will also use the money to be able to deliver new orders to customers as soon as possible.

One challenge Love faces is that she cannot immediately get new orders and deliver them to customers since many of them do not pay their bill as soon as they get their previously ordered items. She then does not have sufficient money on hand to obtain new orders. However, Love finds ways to solve the problem and to make sure that finances in her business flow smoothly. Focusing on the silver lining of every cloud that comes her way, Love is determined to get a commercial space for her business. She continually prays for God's intervention in her life and in the life of her family, so that her children will be able to finish college and have a bright future.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: purchase of silver accessories and other products for sale

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is 21 years old and from Gaza, a city in the Gaza Strip. Tamer is a minibus driver. He started driving the bus two years ago, transporting passengers inside the city of Gaza and now he is transporting passengers between the five cities in the Gaza Strip.

Tamer came to FATEN for a loan to pay for the bus maintenance, which it needs. Maintaining the bus will make it possible for Tamer to work longer hours and increase his income.

Tamer appears in the picture above next to his bus.

loans.use: To pay for bus maintenance

loans.name: Dios Es Bueno 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of her group Dios es bueno 1, 2 & 3 (God is great). She makes her home here in a simple structure with four children and her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to educate and raise her children, in a foreign country, and proviD. what her spouse can't. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to cook and have fun with her family by wacthing tv and others.

Margarita is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for 3 months, starting with her some money she saved, of her family expenses. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing bread, jam, cheese, fruits, sugar, snacks, and others. She will use the profits to buy some present for her children in christmas time and she want to save to reinvest in her business.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to have a business and she was needing the capital to start one. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominates the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy bread, jam, cheese, fruits, sugar, snacks, and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food for her store

loans.name: Beato Roque González Group

texts.es:
El comité está ubicado en la ciudad de Carapeguá en el Barrio Virgen del Rosario.
El Comité esta integrado por 16 señoras muy trabajadoras y activas, se encuentran en el primer ciclo.
Este grupo es muy unido y trabaja en forma conjunta, ellas no presentan inconvenientes con el pago de sus cuotas ni en el relacionamiento entre ellas.
La sra. Marilina R. ha trabajado desde hace muchos años vendiendo comestibles en un almacén, buscando un poco más de apoyo solicitó a la Fundación Paraguaya un crédito, para fomentar através de él sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This committee is located in Virgen del Rosario neighborhood, in the city of Carapeguá.  It has 16 female members who are all very hard-working and active ladies.  They are in their first loan cycle.

This group is very united and works together.  The women have no problems in making their loan repayments nor do they have any problems in their  relationships with each other.

Marilina R. has been selling food in a store for many years.  She was looking for a little more support and so requested a loan from Fundación Paraguaya which would boost her family income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy dairy products, milk, sugar, noodles, yerba, fruit, vegetables, eggs, meat, flour, soda, oil, etc.

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Âgée de plus 49 ans, Madame Safiatou D. réside dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six enfants (1 garçon et 5 filles) à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Safiatou D. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité de fabrication de l’Attieke qu’elle a appris avec une voisine venue de la république de Côte d’Ivoire depuis plus de vingt ans. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal en compagnie de ses amies. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle qui viennent acheter en gros et les revendre en détail. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de six ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association SABALY de Sanooubougou I), elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel commerçant , tous correctement remboursés.
 Vue son expérience dans l’activité au quartier, Madame   Safiatou D.  vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée très généralement de femmes. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 40 sacs de manioc à Sikasso et environnants  et 63 sacs de pâtes de manioc (Tièkèdoro) à Bouaké (République de la Côte d Ivoire) afin de les mélanger pour donner d’Attièkè de bonne qualité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Ms. Safiatou D., aged 49, resides in a large family with her husband and six children (one boy and five girls) in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, Safiatou became familiar with this business making attieke. She learned it from a neighbor from the Republic of Cote d’Ivoire over twenty years ago and operates out of her conjugal home along with her friends.  She is much in demand by her customers, who come to buy wholesale and then sell retail. To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Safiatou decided to rejoin the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over six years ago. After three solidarity loans (group loans) in a women’s association in her district (Association SABALY de Sanooubougou I), she is now on her fifth individual merchant loan. The previous loans were properly repaid. Given her business experience in the area, Safiatou accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed generally of women. With this loan, she intends to buy 40 sacks of cassava in and around Sikasso and 36 sacks of cassava pasta (tièkèdoro) in Bouaké (Republic of Cote d’Ivoire) in order to blend them for making a good quality attieke. Safiatou envisions making a monthly profit of 250,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to cover more of the family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: Buying cassava and cassava pasta

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La señora ROXANA es una socia nueva de la agencia, se encuentra en su primer ciclo, La señora es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora, casada con tres hijos, dos hijos mayores y una hija menor de quince años, su esposo es chofer con vehículo propio, La cliente tiene su domicilio propio y tiene como actividades económica  como líder de ventas de productos cosméticos y por otra parte la venta de cosméticos, el destino del crédito lo invertirá en lo que es la mejora de su vivienda y necesitara dinero para la compra de material de construcción, su deseo de la Sra. ROXANA es la de ver su casita bien refaccionada y terminada y de esta manera poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Roxana is a new member of Emprender who is participating in her first loan cycle. She is a hardworking and enterprising individual. Roxana is married and has three children, two of whom are grown while the youngest daughter is 15 years old. Her husband works as a driver and has his own vehicle. Roxana lives in her own home and earns her living by working as both a cosmetics sales manager and a sales representative.

Her loan will be invested in improvements to her home. She needs the money to buy construction materials. Sra. Roxana wishes to see her house repaired and completed so that her family will be more comfortable. She is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for home repairs and improvements.

loans.name: Verida Antonia

texts.es:
Verida de 62 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que desde pequeña le gustaba tener una tienda por medio de su mama. Después de terminar el Colegio abrió una pequeña tienda.

El trabajo de ella es diario debido al requerimiento de los productos de primera necesidad por partes de vecinos y clientes. Su esposo tiene un puesto de ventas de frutas en el mercado. Con el préstamo quiere incrementar sus ventas de víveres arroz, azúcar, aceites, atunes  y mejorar el aspecto del local. Y en un futuro tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Verida, who is 62 years old, is a hard-working woman who, ever since she was a little girl, wanted to have a store because of her mother. After finishing school, she opened a little store.

Her work is daily, thanks to her neighbors' and customers' needs for basic products. He husband has a stall in the market where he sells fruit. With the loan, she wants to increase her sales of grocery items such as rice, sugar, oils, and olives and improve the appearance of the store. In the future she wants to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and olives.

loans.name: Las Gemelas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Gemelas está conformado por Mariela R., Carla B. y Martha R.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora R. de 23 años quien se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada (ropa, perfumes, shampu, zapatos, platos etc.) el cual inicio con 2,000 cordobas actualmente invierte más ya que su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Ella con el crédito piensa además de invertir en su negocio con la compra de mercaderia poner una venta de comida los fines de semana (sopa y fritanga) y la venta de frutas diario (papaya, melon, sandia, madarina, mango...etc).

Las otras integrantes doña Carla de 32 años vende ropa usada y Martha de 30 años vende ropa, perfumes etc.
texts.en:
The "Las Gemelas" ("The Twins") group consists of Mariela R., Carla B. and Martha R.. The group's coordinator is Mariela, 23, who makes a living selling general supplies (clothing, perfumes, shampoo, shoes, plates, etc.), a business she started with 2,000 cordobas (roughly $90). Now she plans to invest more into her business since it has been growing. 

With this loan she would like to further invest in her business by buying merchandise that would allow her to sell food on the weekends (soup and fried food) and the daily sale of fruit (papaya, cantaloupe, watermelon, mandarin, mango, etc).

The other members of the group are Carla, 32, who sells used clothing, and Martha, 30, who sells clothing, perfumes and other items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoes, perfumes, clothing, shampoo and plates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en casa propia con su compañero D. vida. Posee una pequeña tienda en su casa D. habitación en la cual venD. variedad D. artículos como: pan dulce, galletas, golosinas, huevos, aceite, arroz, azúcar, maicenas, jabón, etc. Es una mujer muy conocida en la zona ya que para ella lo más importante son sus clientes y siempre trata D. dar el mejor servicio y tener su tienda con lo necesario para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan. Últimamente ha visto que sus ventas han incrementado esto la ha hecho pensar un poco y ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su tienda y mantenerla surtida D. diferentes productos como: Frijoles, arroz, aceite, azúcar, café, pan dulce, bebidas, detergentes y D. más artículos que los clientes soliciten. Confía que esta decisión le va a traer resultados favorables y le ayudaran a mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is 35 years old and resides in her own home with her life partner.  She has a small store in her home where she sells a variety of products such as sweet bread, cookies, candy, eggs, oil, rice, sugar, cornmeal, soap, and other items.  She is well-known in the area, which is very important to her customers because they know they will always receive good service and be able to always find what they need whenever they come to her store.  Her sales have increased lately.  

After some thought, Francisca decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can invest in her store and maintain her inventory of different products such as beans, rice, oil, sugar, coffee, sweet bread, beverages, detergents, and other items that her customers request.  She is confident that her decision will bring about favorable results and help to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase various products for her store, such as sweet bread, cookies, candy, eggs, oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single woman living with one parent. She is from Lebanon. After the death of her father, she became the only income provider in the family. So she had to work hard each day to afford their heavy living expenses. In 2009, she was able to open a small grocery shop where she sells dairy and daily products.  Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her store’s inventory. In the future, she is willing to enlarge her shop and add more merchandise into it in order to increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic to make baskets

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with 10 children, nine attend school while one is underage. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly is school fees.

For the past 24 years, she has operated a kindergarten school, teaching children from her nearby community. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments of school fees by parents. She dreams of expanding her school to upper classes in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase desks, repair classrooms and purchase teaching materials. Constance decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase desks, repair classrooms and purchase teaching materials.

loans.name: Reginold

texts.en: Reginold is a twenty-five-year-old hardworking man, and he lives in a family house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling new clothes for two years in a business that he started with the savings he got from a coffee and sugar cane plantation, and now the business has grown up to 8,000,000 UGX. His hardship is debtors who do not pay him on time. His vision to see his business grow up to 20,000,000 UGX, to buy a plot of land and to expand his clothing business. Reginold needs the loan facility to buy shirts, trousers and shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy shirts, trousers and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal, 'perlines' (metal beams) and bolts to replace a roof

loans.name: Sarng

texts.en: Mrs. Sarng is a rice planter in Ornlong Veng.  From her farming business, she can make around $2 a profit for use in daily expenses. She is married and blessed with two school-aged children, while her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. Her husband always uses his old motorbike to pick up passengers who need to go anywhere around their community. Unfortunately, his motorbike often breaks down while he is transporting customers and it is hurting his business.  Because of that, Mrs. Sarng has decided to seek a loan from Kiva, which she will use to repair her husband's broken motorcycle.

loans.use: to fix her husband's broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Agripina Maritza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Maritza nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Ella tiene un  pequeño taller en su domicilio donde se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo bisutería y en otras ocasiones compra productos ya fabricados para poder así abastecer a sus clientes y no dejarlos sin mercadería. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Maritza requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales y herramientas. El sueño de Maritza es abrir una empresa de elaboración de artesanía.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Molinito II" meets monthly in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is known for its tourism and commercial industry, for its traditional festival Inti Raymi, and because it is home to one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu.  

Maritza was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 25 years old and single.  She currently lives in the same city where she was born and where she works.  She has a small workshop in her home where she makes jewelry.  Occasionally she buys products that are already made so that she is able to supply her customers and stock her shop.  She has been running this business for two years and things are going well for her.  At the moment Maritza is requesting a loan to buy materials and tools.  

Maritza's dream is to open her own handicraft business.

loans.use: purchase materials and tools.

loans.name: Clara Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. Clara es socia del banco comunal Las del Rio, vive por la comunidad de El Progreso lugar que es de clima frió, cuenta con lindos paisajes naturales, su gente es carismática, alegre y trabajadora, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones, laboran en la agricultura, cría de animales mucha y de su gente laboran en la ciudad en diferentes áreas de trabajo.

Doña Clara tiene 36 años, está separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 19, 17, 13, 11 y 9 años de edad, sus últimos hijos son gemelos de 1 año y 9 meses, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le  ayudan económicamente, su tercera hija está estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en la escuela. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora Clara tiene una tienda  hace 4 años, labora en ella desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. También se dedica a la cría de borregos, cuyes y cerdos a los que los vende en su comunidad. Hace un año se dedica a la elaboración de sogas.
 
Nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir para la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda y en cuyes.

 Su sueño es tener mayor capital para agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the 'Las del Rio' community bank and lives in El Progreso community.  This is a cold-climate area which has beautiful natural landscapes.  The locals are charismatic, cheerful and hard working people who maintain their culture and traditions.  They work in farming, livestock raising, and many of them work in different jobs in the city.

Clara is 36 years old and separated.  She has seven children from her marriage who are 19, 17, 13, 11 and 9, and twins who are 1 year and 9 months.
Her eldest two children work and help out financially.  Her third child (a daughter) is in high school and her next two are in elementary school.  She owns her own home.

Clara has owned a store for four years.  She works there from 7 o'clock in the morning until 8 o'clock at night.  She also raises lambs, guinea pigs and pigs which she sells in her community.  In addition, she has been making ropes for one year.

Our member is on her second loan and she will invest it in buying essential household products for her store and guinea pigs.  Her dream is to have more capital so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy essential household products and guinea pigs

loans.name: Trinite Group

texts.fr: TRINITE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Akuta Isabelle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un policier du nom de Joseph. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Akuta Isabelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Akuta Isabelle est allée à l'école. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Akuta Isabelle mène comme activité depuis dix huit ans, la vente de tissus par le système de livraison. Akuta Isabelle achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Akuta Isabelle sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui permettra certainement à Akuta Isabelle et aux autres membres du groupe TRINITE, d’accroître leur stock de produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: TRINITE (TRINITY) is a group of three people, who reside in the same district in Bénin. The leader of the group, Akuta Isabelle (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 37 years old and is married to a policeman named Joseph. The couple has two children, both in school, and in their care. Akuta Isabelle lives together with her husband and their children. The couple provides for the needs of the household together. Akuta Isabelle went to school. In order to support her children and to ensure that their needs are met, Akuta Isabelle has carried out her business for 18 years, the sale of fabric using a delivery system. Akuta Isabelle buys her products in Bénin. It is the second time that Akuta Isabelle has asked for a loan from ALIDé, the loan is certain to allow Akuta Isabelle and the other members of the TRINITE (TRINITY) group to increase their stock of products and to better respond to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children.
 
Carlos has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He is also buying and selling chickens/broilers. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Carlos has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Carlos hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, a 41-year-old resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a security guard, and mother of three children, two of whom are studying, while one is still at home. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

The operator of a rug-making business, Rowena mainly offers rugs, from those round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats, braided quilts and bed sheets, and other crafts that most rug-makers sell. Rugs, a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, are some of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from peddler selling from the side of the highway. Rowena also earns additional income from the direct-selling of products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of Php300 in sales everyday.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php9, 000 loan to buy more raw materials such as fabrics, threads, etc. for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Rowena hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving all her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase apples, grapes, guavas, bananas, watermelons, cantaloupes, papayas, rambutans, red mombins, and mangoes.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eluid is 21 years old. He is single and does not support anybody in the family. He is borrowing a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings, which he intends to use to expand his business with assorted spare parts of different phones.

He plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profit from the business, and to increase his stock. This is his first loan, and his dreams and hopes are to ensure that his business is expanded in a positive way.

loans.use: to buy assorted spare parts of different phones.

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Mr. Om, 31, is a loving father of two single children. He lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. As shown in the picture, Mr. Om and his wife are working with their rice husking machine under a house. This business activity earns him a good profit because there are many villagers who come to use his services, especially after their harvesting season. This couple is quite busy with farming during the rainy season but in the dry season there will be a lot of work to do as well. Mr. Om hopes to update his living conditions in the near future, so he has made many plans for his family businesses. 

Now Om is seeking a loan from HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, to buy a plowing machine. This tool can be used on his own farmland. Moreover, it will make more profit for the family if his neighbors and other villagers want to rent this machine. Om is very thankful to all Kiva’s funders who support his business.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine.

loans.name: Munhtuya

texts.en:
Munhtuya is 33 years old and lives with her husband and twin sons in a ger (Mongolian yurt), in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband works in a leather factory and her sons study in school. 

Munhtuya started her grocery retail business in 2008 by renting a counter in the market. Now that major market is opening in a new area, and Munhtuya rented a counter there. Therefore, she needs a supply to run the place. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy more grocery products.

Munhtuya is a sharp and diligent woman who says "The new market is in highly crowded place therefore I believe it will pay off."

loans.use: to buy more grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Koffi Mawulé

texts.fr:
Koffi est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
Koffi est informaticien et a ouvert un cyber depuis 2004. Il s’est installé dans un quartier de la place.
Koffi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus d’ordinateurs pour agrandir son cyber. Il veut investir dans l’activité avec le profit réalisé. 
Dans les prochaines années, Koffi voudrait avoir d’autres cybers pour permettre à la population de mieux surfer . Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit de améliorer son niveau de vie.
texts.en: Koffi is a 34-year old man, who is single and has no children. He is a computer technician and opened a cyber-café in 2004. He is situated in one of the town' districts. He has requested a first loan from WAGES in order to buy more computers and expand his cyber-café. He wants to invest the profits he makes in his business. In the coming years, Koffi would like to have other cyber-cafés in order to allow people to surf the net better. He says that he wants to improve his living standards with the profits.

loans.use: to buy more computers

loans.name: Touk's Group

texts.en:
Touk is 29 years old, married and has only son studying in a primary school. He lives in a rural area located in the Ratanak Mondul district where crop farming is common. He has earned a living as a peasant who grows red maize on his farmland for ten years and he supplements his income by working as a worker. 

This is Touk’s first group loan with VisionFund. Now requesting for a loan, he will use this loan to hire workers to harvest his maize crops. He hopes to make more maize to better support his family and also keep his son in school.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest his maize crops

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 34 years old. She is married to a businessman. She has two children, ages three and 15. With the loan, she plans to add more items such as salt, cooking oil, rice, and shoes for the same business she has been running for one year. She plans to use the profits to build her residential house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and to add shoes to her inventory.

loans.name: Naumi

texts.en:
Naumi is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Naumi has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production). 

She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy coconut and bananas to sell.

Naumi has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Naumi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Evodia

texts.es:
La señora Evodia  es  madre soltera tiene cuarenta años de edad , y tiene la cantidad de tres hijos .
Ella nos cuenta que  antes tenia mucho miedo por que no sabia como ayudar a sus hijos  para que tuvieran una mejor vida y valoraran lo que ella hacia para que tuvieran lo mejor.
Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como son: entomatadas ,sopes ,huraches y empanadas de pollo, quesillo  y chorizo con tortillas echas a mano y salsa de molcajete .
Tambien se dedica a la venta de jarafones con agua por mayoreo y menudeo.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes como son: chiles verdes ,quesillo ,chorizo, pollo  quesos cebolla ,ajo, mayonesa  verduras y maíz para la elaboración de tortillas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla  a triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Evodia is 40 years old and a single mother of three children.  She says that she used to be very afraid because she didn't know how to help her children have a better life and value what she did so that they would have the best.

She works selling Mexican dishes such as entomatadas (tortillas with a tomato sauce), sopes (fried tortilla with beans, onion, and hot sauce), huraches (tortilla and bean based dish in the shape of a sandal), chicken empanadas, and quesillo cheese and chorizo sausage with handmade tortillas and salsa.  

She also works selling bottles of water at wholesale and retail.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase ingredients such as green chiles, quesillo cheese, chorizo sausage, chicken, cheese, onions, garlic, mayonnaise, vegetables, and corn to make tortillas.  

She is grateful to the Foundation for helping her triumph in life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Patrick wants to incease his stock of produce. He sells maize, millet, cassava, and many of the Ugandan staple foods. There is a lot of demand for his goods, and he wants to buy produce now at low prices. He will then keep them in store so that he can sell them after harvesting season when the price

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif opened a food shop in 2004 in Beylagan town and later he borrowed $500 from Normicro, Beylagan branch to buy foodstuffs to sell in the shop. Thus he has established his business. Now his business is developing and he needs to buy more foodstuff to increase the stock. For this purpose he is in need of $1000.

loans.use: To increase the volume of goods

loans.name: Moana

texts.en:
Moana freely expresses how privileged she feels to be able to be not just a mother of four children but also a businesswoman.

She and her husband run a small vegetable farm on their land. The income that the vegetables bring in is their sole source of income.

Her husband does most of the farm work, while Moana is the one who hauls the produce to the market and sells it.

She feels the best way for them to raise their standard of living is to invest further in their vegetable farming. Thus, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve their crop yield, which, hopefully, will lead directly to a boost in income.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en: Le Thi Luong, 23, seen in the photograph, is one of TYM Fund client Nguyen Thi Muoi's 5 children. Mrs. Muoi is 53 and runs a mobile phone card business which has become very successful since last year, when a second mobile service provider arrived at the small town of Do Luong and the price of phonecalls went down. Mrs. Muoi and her family also run an outdoor cafe offering tea, coffee, beer and snacks. On a hot day they have up to 100 guests. Mrs. Muoi is asking for a loan of US$250 to buy more drinks and SIM cards for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and phone cards for sale

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Mrs. Bina C., 27 years old, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur.  She lives in a joint family household with 6 members: her husband, mother, 2 daughters and a son.  Her Husband, Mr. Puspa C., has no work.  He is illiterate and unemployed.  Her life is miserable and she is unable to run her house smoothly.

Her two daughters are studying in grade 6 and 4 respectively and her son is in primary school.  All her children are studying in a government school due to the lack of money.  She wants to send her children to boarding school, but cannot afford the school fees.

Mrs. C. opened her vegetable shop a few months ago to overcome her family's problems.  She seeks $150 to buy vegetables such as green vegetables and other vegetables to sell in the market to earn more.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her shop

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion is 28, married with 3 children and she cares for 2 orphans. She has a produce store which she has operated for 4 years. Some of the items in her store are beans, millet, maize, flour, rice, etc. She recently was able to purchase a small plot of land and she dreams of one day building a home on it. She currently rents. She is very determined and hard working. For now, she plans to continue building her business in Kayunga and wants to use her loan to increase her store supplies of produce staples and personal hygiene items.

loans.use: To increase her supplies of staples and personal hygiene items.

loans.name: Omar Zeus

texts.es:
Two years ago, Omar began driving a taxi in Reynosa and nowadays, he has regular customers that ask him to drive them around the city. His family motivates him to keep working hard and try get ahead with this job because he wasn't able to get a job anywhere else, since he only finished elementary school, and companies don't hire people with so little education.

However, his struggle is ongoing, and he has to take care of the car that allows him to be a taxi driver. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $250 that he will pay back in a term of 6 months. With this money, Omar will be able to repair his taxi so that he can continue to be productive. With your help, Omar and his family can continue getting ahead and maintain the functionality of thier source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Hace dos años, Omar comenzó a ofrecer sus servicios como taxista, en Reynosa, y actualmente tiene ya cielotes que le piden los mueva por la ciudad. Su familia lo motivó para salir adelante por medio de esta actividad, ya que en ningún lugar le daban empleo puesto que estudió hasta la primaria y las empresas ya no contratan a personas con tan pocos estudios.

Sin embargo la lucha es constante, y tiene que cuidar el carro que le permite ser taxtista es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de $250 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, con este dinero Omar podrá comprarle refacciones a su taxi, para que le siga dando productividad. Con tu ayuda Omar y su familia podrán salir adelante y mantener funcionando su fuente de ingresos.

loans.use: Taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is from the Tayy Loma de Carapeguá company. She is 42 years old and has been married for 15 years. She and her husband have two small children who live with them in their own house.

Her husband is a driver of a passenger bus. She sells crafts such as bed quilts, hammocks and, more importantly, thermoses lined with engraved leather. This last item generates a good earning for her. This is because thermoses are used a lot here since one of the most typical drinks of our country is “terere” which is similar to “mate” only because it is served with really cold water.

The sale of these thermoses increases considerably in this season of the year since the summer is when there is the most demand. As a result, Elena is soliciting a credit with which she can acquire a great quantity of thermoses from a supplier who gives her a good discount.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es de la compañía Tayy Loma de Carapeguá, ella tienen 42 años de edad esta casada hace ya 15 años y tienen dos hijos pequeños viven con ellos en una casa propia de la pareja.

Su marido es chofer de un bus de pasajeros, y ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías como colchas para cama, hamacas y especialmente termos forrados en cuero gravados. Este último le genera bastante ganancia puesto que los termos son muy utilizados acá, ya que una de las bebidas mas típicas de nuestro país es el “terere” que es parecido al mate solo que se sirve con agua bien fría.

La venta de estos termos aumenta considerablemente en esta época del año ya que en el verano es cuando hay mayor demanda de los mismos, por ello solicita un crédito con los que podrá adquirir en gran cantidad termos de un proveedor que le concederá un buen descuento.

loans.use: Purchase of thermoses at wholesale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos D. B. is a young, single man who is very hardworking. This young man's business is a coffee shop located at the municipal market of Chichigalpa. This client says he's owned the business for 10 years since he inherited it from his mother, who decided to hand over her business to her only son when she fell ill; she was confident knowing he would manage it. Throughout the years, he has invested in his business, but now a days has the need to acquire products such as coffee, bread, butter, etc.

For this reason, he turned to Ceprodel which has provided much support with loans for 4 years now. He has used these loans to purchase products and to maintain his house. Juan Carlos has a record of 21 past loans and it is necessary to highlight that he has paid all of them back on time and according to the terms established.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Carlos D. B. es un joven soltero muy esforzado. El negocio de este joven es un cafetín que está ubicado en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Este cliente nos cuenta que el negocio lo obtiene hace 10 años por herencia de su mamá ya que al entrar en una crisis de enfermedad decide entregar su negocio a su único hijo muy confiadamente de que él lo iba a administrar. A través de los años ha invertido en su negocio pero hoy en día tiene la necesidad de adquirir los productos como el café, pan, mantequilla, etc.

Para esto acude a Ceprodel que con mucho apoyo le ha beneficiado con créditos desde hace 4 años habiéndolos invertido en la compra de sus productos y además para el mantenimiento de su hogar. Juan Carlos tiene un record de 21 créditos que es necesario destacar que todos los ha pagado en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, bread, and butter

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia F. is a 58 year old mother of three.  She runs a clothing business, which she began with the help of her husband sixteen years ago.  She now sells all sorts of clothing goods in the city of Caaguazú, including shirts, blouses, pants, jeans and skirts.In order to keep up with the changing fashion styles, she must invest in the latest pants, blouses, underwear, bathing suits, among others.  Currently, Amelia travels to the neighboring countries of Brazil and Bolivia to explore and purchase cheaper clothing.

loans.use: To buy various clothing and cloth goods for her business

loans.name: Sarafina's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Sarafina is 33 years old and is a married woman with two children, aged 10 and 4. Sarafina has owned a small pharmacy since 1999, and she works every day from 7 am to 11 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Gladness and Elizabeth, who have businesses of trading and a salon.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Christabel

texts.en:
Christabel is a 33-year-old entrepreneur with five school-aged children. She lives in Kisumu, Kenya, where she opened a second-hand clothes shop in 2004. She specializes in women’s clothing: skirts, dresses, casual apparel and bed sheets. From time to time, she travels to Nairobi, where she buys a good variety of items at wholesale prices. Her shop is on a prime location along a busy street. That, plus her three years of experience and her friendly attitude, have allowed her to establish a good clientele base. Christabel has applied for a loan of $800 to expand her business.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Silvia Susana

texts.es:
Silvia is 45 years old and has 2 children that still depend on her support. She has some advanced education completed and lives in the neighborhood La Libertad in Trujillo, Peru.

Since several years ago she makes a living selling clothing for men, women and children, such as shoes and sandals. She accomplishes this by taking orders and delivering them to her friends and family. In order to increase her income, she also works as a domestic employee in the home of a friend.

She is a member of the community bank United for Progress II (Unidas Para el Progreso II) of the Manuela Ramos movement. This is where she received her first loan of about USD $100 (300 soles) and invested it in the purchase of clothing, shoes and other inventory.

The loan of USD $625, which she will repay in 4 months, will be invested in her business.

Silvia dreams of being able to travel to other countries and being able to buy merchandise abroad, thus evolving into a great entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Silvia tiene 45 años, con 02 hijos dependientes aun de ella, tiene estudios superiores de educación inconclusos, y vive en la Urb. La Libertad- Trujillo – Perú.

Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños así como zapatos, sandalias, este trabajo lo realiza en la modalidad de entrega de pedidos a domicilio a familiares y amigos.

Además trabaja como empleada doméstica en casa de una amiga, esto con el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “ Unidas Para El Progreso II”, del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, donde recibió un primer préstamo de S/.300 decidió invertirlo en la compra de ropa, zapatos y demás.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1700. el cual será cancelado en 4 meses lo invertirá en su negocio.

Silvia sueña con poder viajar a otros países y poder comprar su mercadería en el extranjero y así convertirse en una gran empresaria.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba A. is 45 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of two children. Her husband is a businessman.

Mahbuba is in the cattle-selling business and she currently has 4 cows. About twenty years ago, her family faced mounting financial problems, so she decided to become a cattlewoman. Specifically, Mahbuba buys small cattle at the market at a low price, feeds them, and then re-sells them at the same market at a higher price to generate profits. Her elder sons also work with her in this business. Mahbuba works extremely hard in order to make the business successful and to generate a sufficient amount of income for the family.

Now, Mahbuba is planning to purchase additional cattle to raise and to thereafter sell for a profit. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting $600 for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan she has requested, but Mahbuba asserts that she will not be delinquent in any way and will promptly repay the loan according to its terms.

loans.use: To expand her business and to better support her family by purchasing additional cattle.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana is married with 4 children: 2 daughters, aged 12 and 14 and two sons, aged 4 and 8. She started her business 3 years ago because she wanted to contribute to the family economy while still taking good care of her children. She opened a butcher shop at that time. Little by little she realized that she was capable of successfully growing it into a more formal business. That is exactly what she trying to do now but she lacks the capital to acquire more products and improve her sales.

She needs a loan for $250, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy merchandise. With your help Adriana will grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Adriana es casada y tiene 4 hijos: 2 niñas de 14 y 12, y 2 niños de 8, y 4 años, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años ya que quería contribuir a la economía de su casa pero sin descuidar a sus hijos por ello decidió poner una carnicería, poco a poco se fue dando cuenta que podía lograr formar un negocio mas formal que es lo que esta intentando en la actualidad pero les hace falta capital para adquirir mas productos y mejorar sus ventas.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu ayuda Adriana hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Biyam

texts.en:
Biyam is 26 years old, married with three children aged 9, 5 and 1. Biyam sells soap, potatoes and charcoal and has been doing so since 2005. She earns a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Biyam is seeking a loan to increase her stock and so improve her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock levels.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de cinq (04) enfants, madame H. Abla est couturière de profession, elle réside à Lomé avec son mari, un journaliste caméraman. Madame H. Abla aide son mari à  s’occuper des charges financières de la maison, ce qui ne lui permet pas de faire des stocks de produits de mercerie en quantité suffisante dont elle a besoin pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Ainsi, elle sollicite ce crédit pour pouvoir agrandir son commerce de produits de mercerie et rénover sa boutique au goût de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Abia H. is married and the mother of four (4) children. She is a seamstress by trade and resides in Lomé with her husband who is a journalist cameraman. Mrs. Abia H. assists her husband in providing for the expenses of the home which does not allow her to build up a sufficient supply of products that she needs to satisfy her customers. She is therefore requesting this loan to increase her supply of sewing materials and renovate her store to her customers needs.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of sewing materials

loans.name: Nelly Ruth

texts.es:
Con años D. experiencia en la venta D. menúes para gente D. su barrio y uno que otro cliente esporádico, la señora Nelly junto con su familia han visto una gran oportunidad en la construcción D. cientos D. departamentos que se harán en su barrio, lo que incluye cientos D. trabajadores y es ahí donD. entraría a tallar el negocio D. la señora: está casi cerrado un contrato con los mismos ingenieros para abastecer D. almuerzos a gran parte D. los trabajadores en los próximos meses.


Teniendo que comprar tapers, insumos para la preparación D. sus comidas e implementar su cocina en sí y con ollas más grandes, es que requiere del préstamo D. 900 soles, algo que ansía junto con sus 3 menores hijos y esposo.
texts.en:
With years of experience in the sale of prix fixe meals for the people of her neighborhood and some sporadic clients, Señora Nelly and her family have found a great opportunity in the construction of hundreds of apartments that will be put up in their neighborhood, including hundreds of workers. This is where she started to build her business. She has almost concluded a contract with the engineers to supply lunches to the majority of the workers in the upcoming months. Having to buy candles, ingredients for the meals, plus putting together her kitchen with larger cookers, is why she needs this loan of $300, something she, her husband, and her 3 minor children are longing to do.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish setting up her kitchen and living room for dinner clients, plus meal ingredients

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary U., 40, and her husband, Mr. Phea Pok, 44, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Her husband has been a mason since 1991, and he used to be a soldier. They were married in 1984 and have four children; three sons and one daughter. One of their sons is a construction worker with his father, and the other children study in the local school.

Since 1980, Sotheary has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes the products to sell in Phnom Penh. Sotheary requests a loan of $300 to purchase silk materialS for weaving.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Tusk

texts.en:
J. was born the year 1959, and is happily married with eight children, three below 15 years.
