Being a very hard-working man with a large family, he has faced some challenges in life such as ill health, poor harvests, and school drop out because of inadequate finance, and he is not able to pay for his children's school fees. Because of all these challenges, J. saw GHAPE as a source of relief in the year 2007. In this same year J. received his first loan of 40,000frs, and the repayment was done promptly. 

Given a loan of 200,000FRS, he plans to buy one load of firewood for 70,000FRS, wood for timber for 80,000FRS, and transportation for the wood and timber costing 50,000FRS. He will start repayment from the day of disbursement. The success of the business is guaranteed because he has experience in the business and he has a ready market for the goods. He plans to use the profit from the business to pay school fees fore his children, give good medical attention to his family and also good food to his family. J. prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE, and he has been thought how to manage the loan in GHAPE, and the method of repayment is comfortable.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients, and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying and selling of firewood.

loans.name: Manzooran Khalil Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Manzooran baji is 33 years old, married, and resides in the city of Vehari, Pakistan. She has lived with her family for the past 5 years. Her husband, K. A. is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and has 20 years experience. Manzooran baji is a mother of four children: three daughters and one son. Her son works in a grocery shop as a salesman and earns a monthly wage. Her daughters help her in her clothes sewing business. She teaches them how to cut and shape a dress and how to sew it. Now her first two daughters are trained and they can sew clothes easily by themselves. Manzooran baji feels very pleased to watch them work. This work gives herself and her daughters a good income. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw. 

Manzooran baji  is also the leader of a women's loan group. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. Shahida mai baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her motorbike rental business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
Mr. Dara C., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Preyvan Vanna, 35, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married for ten years and have seven children: five sons and two daughters. Three of them stay with their aunt in Phnom Penh, two children are in school and another one is still young.

Dara has been driving Motor Remorque taxi (Remorque is a motorbike with a trailer at the back) for eleven years. He carries goods and people from his village to Takhmao and Phnom Phenh and from Takhmao to his village. His wife has been a garment factory worker for six years.

Dara plans to repair his motorbike and trailer because it is very old and broken in some parts so he is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to repair his Remorque.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and trailer

loans.name: 29 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.vi:
* Nhóm 29 gồm 5 thành viên,sống tại thôn 5 xã Quảng Hưng là một đơn vị nghèo của tỉnh Thanh Hóa cách Hà Nội 156 Km về phía nam.Chị Phạm Thị Thư mang mã số thành viên 0095 là nhóm trưởng.Gia đình chị kinh tế rất khó khăn,chồng chị mất sớm để lại một mình chị nuôi 5 người con ăn học. Chu kỳ trước chị vay vốn để mua gà giống và số gà chị đã được thu hoạch. Số tiền lãi từ chăn nuôi gà chị thu được là 500.000 VNĐ chị dành  cho con đóng tiền học. Chu kỳ này chị vay tiếp mức vay với số tiền là 2.442.600 VND ~142 USD để mua gà giống và phân bón ruộng.Các thành viên trong nhóm cũng có cùng mức vay.
* Chị C. Thị Phúc vay vốn để mua gạo tráng bánh cuốn và bánh đa.
* Chị Q. Thị Tiến vay vốn mua rau về bán.
* Chị N. Thị Chung vay vốn để đầu tư vào cửa hàng tạp hóa.
* Chị N. Thị Hòa vay vốn để mua cá về bán.
texts.en:
Group 29 has five members. They live in Village 5, Quảng Hưng commune, a poor village in Thanh Hóa province, 156 km south of Hà Nội. Mrs. Phạm Thị Thư is the group leader. Her family has faced serious financial difficulties ever since her husband passed away at an early age, leaving her to raise five young children alone. In the previous lending cycle, she used a loan to buy breeding hens and then sold off the additional chickens produced. The profit from that enterprise, 500,000 VND (30 USD), she set aside to pay for her children’s education. In this lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 2,442,600 VND (~145 USD) to buy breeding hens again, as well as fertilizer for her rice field. The other members of the group are requesting the same amount. Mrs. C. Thị Phúc will use her loan to buy rice to make rice pancakes and rice paper. Mrs. Q. Thị Tiến will use her loan to buy vegetables she can sell at the market. Mrs. N. Thị Chung will use her loan to invest in a grocery shop. Mrs. N. Thị Hòa will use her loan to buy fish she can sell at the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Breeding hens, fertilizer

loans.name: Rejina

texts.es:
la sra. Rejina I. se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de pasteles, ella tiene 2 años y medio de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella hace pasteles para cumpleaños, bodas, fiestas de empresas, etc. sus pasteles son bien vendidos ya que a muchos de sus clientes les gusta el sabor, ya que son muy sabrosos y esponjosos, la decoracion de los pasteles tambien es muy buena ya que puede hacer de diferentes formas como ser barney, barbie, dibujos animados, etc. ella es de la zona Villa Santa y ahi son muy pocas las personas que se dedican a este tipo de actividad. ella es casada y su esposo se dedica a la caficultura los dos salen adelante con los gastos del hogar, tienen un hijo el cual depende de los dos al 100%. 
ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas materiales para hacer sus pasteles ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes y ella se queda siempre sin producto a muy tempranas horas del dia.
texts.en:
Rejina I. dedicates herself to making and selling cakes, an activity she has carried out for 2 ½ years. She makes cakes for birthdays, weddings, corporate events, etc. Her cakes sell well because many of her customers like their flavor, as they are very good and moist. She also decorates the cakes beautifully, and can make different themes/characters such as Barney, Barbie, and others. She comes from the Villa Santa zone, where few people dedicate themselves to this type of business. She is married, and her husband works in coffee agriculture. They both get ahead with the household costs, and have one son who depends on them 100%. She needs the credit in order to purchase more ingredients to make her cakes, as customer demand is high and she often runs out of products early in the day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, eggs, milk, food coloring and flavoring, cardboard trays.

loans.name: Maria Luvis

texts.en:
Maria Luvis R. owns a tricycle (a motorcyle with a side car which is being used as a common public utility vehicle in the rural areas). She is 42 years old and has only 1 child. Her husband, Ricardo R. is driving their small tricycle to supplement the family income. She is planning to establish her own sari-sari store. 
She is now requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI to  repair her tricycle and start buying merchandise for her store. She believes that by selling more items she will have more profit; therefore, the loan will truly help her family to earn bigger income. 

CEVI is helping Maria Luvis to sustain her business, providing credit, training and insurance coverage to feed and clothe her family.

loans.use: To repair his tricycle and purchase permit and start a new business

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon A. is a thirty-eight year old married man and the father of four children, all of whom are boys. The firstborn is currently in the senior high school and the rest are in the junior high and the primary schools. His wife is a hardworking woman. She is a farmer and a trader as well. She trades in infant layettes. Solomon lives with his family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase, a farming and busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Solomon deals in building materials such as roofing sheets, nails, cement, paint, etc. He sells in a store in the market square and has been in business for four years.

Solomon wants a loan to procure more goods to increase his stock. He is hopeful to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure more building materials to increase his stock

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has two children, one son and one daughter. According to her, both of her children are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

Florence works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver while she is a trader. She trades in printed textiles and jewels. She procures the goods from Accra and hawks to sell in her community. Florence also treks to sell in other towns as well. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure textiles in bulk. She is hoping to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es: Teofilo tiene 47 años, es un hombre muy noble, vive en su casa propia junto a su amada esposa, quien le dio 4 hijos. De los cuales, los mayores estudian en el colegio de la ciudad, y los menores en la escuela de su comunidad. Por más de 27 años, se viene dedicando a la siembra de papa, olluco y cebada en chacras  alquiladas, durante estos años acumuló experiencia agrícola, tales como el conocimiento temporal del ciclo del año para priorizar qué productos sembrar, ya que de ello dependerá el resultado de sus cosechas, pero pese a tener experiencia, no siempre acierta en sus siembras. Es por ello que observa y contempla constantemente sus cultivos, para detectar a tiempo y fumigar cualquier amenaza de plaga. Teofilo está muy contento con sus cultivos, ya que durante estos años nunca ha perdido, y sus productos, algunas veces, fueron exportados a otras ciudades, lo que le ha permitido acumular buenas ganancias, con estas, pudo comprar otras tierras donde viene incrementando sus siembras. Este es su tercer préstamo consecutivo con MFP, durante estos créditos ha demostrado puntualidad en cada uno de sus pagos, y para este nuevo ciclo hace promesas de seguir trabajando igual. Asimismo, se siente muy feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde está ahorrando su dinero. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados, piensa comprar insecticidas para fumigar sus cultivos contra los mosquitos que vienen perjudicando las hojas de sus papas y arvejas (en la foto sale con su mochila fumigadora).
texts.en:
Teofilo is 47 years old. He is a very noble man, living in his own home together with his beloved wife who gave him four children. Of them, the eldest are attending school in the city and the youngest go to the community school. For more than 27 years he has been harvesting potatoes, sweet potatoes and wheat on rented fields. During these years he gathred agricultural experience, such as the seasons of the year to better prioritize the kinds of harvest of the time of year. This ultimately translates to the success of his harvests, but although he has this experience, he doesn't always enjoy large harvests. He constantly tends to and looks after his harvests, to immediatley know when it's time to fumigate against any pests. Teofilo loves his harvests, especially because it has been many years since he's lost out. Sometimes he exports to other cities and this helps him increase his earnings even more. With savings he managed to purchase more land where he continuously increases his plantations. This is his third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and during these loan periods he has always been on time with his payments. For this new loan he promises to show the same responsibility. He feels so happy to belong to a community bank, from where he is borrowing the funds. With the seven hundred neuvos soles requested, he will purchase insecticides to fumigate his harvests agains mosquitoes that damange the leaves from the potato and pea plants. (In the photo he can be seen wearing his fumigation gear).


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building poles in bulk

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a 40-year-old married mother of five children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives with her husband in Sefwi, in the western region of Ghana.

Comfort prepares and sells pastries, such as doughnuts and meat pies. Her pastries are tasty and fresh, which means that she has many customers. She also takes bulk orders from retailers. However, Comfort complains of stock increment at the market making it difficult to make enough sales. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy flour, margarine, sugar etc. to prepare more pastries to sell. It is her dream to save more in order to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Mairambi

texts.ru: Майрамби Рахимова проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 41 год. Вдова, имеет  5 детей. Майрамби более 2 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает крупно рогатый скот. В данный момент она на полученную сумму хочет купить теленка, чтобы в дальнейшем продавать молоко.
texts.en:
Mairambi R. lives in the Hamadoni district. She is a 41-year-old widow with five children. For more than two years, Mairambi has been engaged in raising cattle. She raises and sells bighorn cattle. At the moment, she wants the loan amount to purchase a calf, in order in the long term to sell milk.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip B. has been operating a motorcycle transport business in Naivasha town for four years. He is a 28-year-old man, married to Mary Muganda, and they have one child. He heard about KADET through a friend and applied for a first loan, which he has repaid well. He bought a new motorbike for himself with the loan and now he wants to buy another new motorcycle with the help of a second loan. He plans to employ someone to operate it for him. He hopes to grow in the public transport business: creating employment for others and also boosting his income.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: La señora Gina tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo, quien es agricultor, y con sus dos hijos que están estudiando. Ella tiene una pequeña bodega que instaló en su casa, donde vende productos comestibles de primera necesidad (huevos, fideos, arroz, leche, pan, etc.), además de diversas bebidas. En esta actividad ya lleva un periodo de 2 años, atendiendo su negocio todos los días a cualquier hora del día. Lo que le gusta a Gina de su tienda es que mediante ella se relaciona con muchas personas y darles una buena atención es lo principal para ella, además que es una labor que la mantiene ocupada y se siente muy útil. Por otro lado, es un negocio rentable, ya que por donde ella vive es la única bodega. Adicionalmente, Gina es propietaria de un motocarro, el cual también le genera buenos ingresos diarios, pues lo alquila para que realicen transporte de pasajeros. Para más adelante quiere ampliar su tienda y contar con un local más grande que le permita tener minimarket y así facilitar a sus vecinos con sus necesidades diarias. Ese es su 6to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes se ayudan entre sí y son muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando invertirá en la compra de diversos productos para implementar su negocio y ofrecer diversidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gina is 62 years old and lives with her husband -- a farmer -- and her two children who are students. She has a small grocery store that she installed in her house, where she sells basic foods, such as eggs noodles, rice, milk, bread, etc., as well as drinks. She has been engaged in this activity for two years, attending her business everyday at whatever hour of the day.

What Gina likes most about her store is that it enables her to have contact with many people and give them good service. Moreover, it keeps her occupied and makes her feel very useful. Besides, it is a profitable business, since it is the only store where she lives.

In addition, Gina owns a motor car, which also generates good daily income. She rents it out to carry passengers. In the future, she wants to expand her store and acquire a larger space that will permit her to have a mini-market and, thus, better supply her neighbors with their daily necessities.

This is Gina's sixth loan from MFP. What she likes about working with her community bank is that all the members help each other and are very responsible about their payments. With this money she will invest in buying products to expand her business and offer more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: EXPAND HER MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Asllam Madine Group

texts.en:
A. M. wants to take out a loan for his general store in order to purchase more goods; thus, significantly expanding his offerings. Jalel Jan would like to obtain a loan for his bakery: he wants to take on a new shop. Nazam M. wishes to use his loan for his general store. He hopes to attract more clients. Qahera would like a loan to use for her medical materials.

A. M. is the leader of the A. M. Group. There are four members in this group, all of whom hope to expand their businesses. The group wants to take out a loan of 40,000 afghani. They are happy to have the opportunity to access this kind of lending process, that can support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. sells smoked fish; she buys fish from the fishermen to smoke at Elmina Kumasi.  Victoria has no educational background.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Victoria has been selling smoked fish since 2005. She supports the husband in the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to process for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to help further the childrens education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fish to process for sale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 35 years old, and she is married with four children.  To earn a living, she operates a general store, where she sells goods such as candles, beverages, sugar, and detergents.  She is now seeking a loan in the amount of N80,000 ($550) in order to purchase more provisions for resale purposes.  She expresses her deep gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional provisions

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy B., from the village of Tuyabang Alto, is 41 years old, married and has one grown children. To make a living, Juvy owns and operates a flower business whose main source of income comes from planting and harvesting flowers for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Juvy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid her previous loan from PMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be Juvy's eighth loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma E. runs a food stall selling specialty food products in her community. She is 47 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is from the village of Iligan City. Norma has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Norma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 46 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen y están bajo su poder.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Luisa, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the "Corazón de Jesús" (Heart of Jesus) Communal Bank, in the San José de Sisa District, in the Province of El Dorado, in the Department of San Martín. She is 46 years-old, lives with her partner, and is the mother of 3 children, 2 of which still depend on her. Her character and her desire to see her dreams realized motivated her to begin her own business selling groceries, whose profits she adds to the income of the household. From the beginning she has slowly been winning more customers. Today she has loyal customers who everyday come to her convenience store to shop because there they can find all the products a household needs, and because she personally attends to them with her usual charisma. With this loan of S/1000.00 she will buy bags of rice and sugar, cookies, noodles, salt packets, milk, conserved fish in boxes and in a variety of brands, eggs, and personal hygiene products, all to provide better service to her customers. Luisa is very happy to continue working and very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her have opportunities to develop in their different occupations.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries to stock convenience store.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. She has owned a grocery store since 2006. She also sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products, etc.

Fadia requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her fourth loan and she has always repaid on time. Her previous loans helped her improve her work by diversifying her merchandise and offering more products.

Fadia is special in her work because she opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and traders. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to purchase a lot of merchandise. Fadia decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income, and also because she always wanted to work for herself.

In future, Fadia plans to keep on improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy carpentry supplies (lumber, nails, glue, sandpaper, accessories)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Nazmia

texts.en:
Nazmia is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Bekaa with her husband and two children. She has been working as a seamstress since 1998. After Nazmia decided to start her business, she gained experience in sewing and also learned her trade by attending training. She repairs and makes dresses, skirts, shirts and other items. She works from home and does not own a shop. Her customers are her friends and neighbors.
When Nazmia first started her business, she didn’t have a good sewing machine and was not really known. However, she knew how to improve her work and make herself known to potential customers. Moreover, her previous loans helped her improve her work by purchasing a better sewing machine and increasing her number of customers. Nazmia's business is successful because she knows how to treat her customers, and is known for her good and talented work.
Nazmia has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to open a small sewing shop. This is her fourth loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

loans.use: To open a small sewing shop

loans.name: Flor De Pascua Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario conformado por tres socias, Albertina C., tiene una venta de tortillas y venta de refacciones, Milva Alicia, una tienda de ropa y micelanea, Sara tiene una panadería.
Sara tiene 40 años de edad, vive en Patzun; tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales 1 ya esta casado, 2 graduados y 4 estudiando, su negocio es una panadería, sus hijos la ayudan, ella vende 3 días a la semana los días de mercado. Tiene 20 años de tener su negocio, con la ayuda de su esposo ha podido superarse y ahora tiene la necesidad de adquirir un crédito para poder comprar la materia prima; ya que se acerca la Semana Santa, (tradición en Guatemala) para muchos es costrumbre la compra de pan, y es cuando su negocio tiene demanda. El sueño de Sara es darles una casa a sus hijos y una mejor vida.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three partners: Albertina C., who has a tortilla shop and also sells spare parts; Milva Alicia has a clothing and accessories store; and Sara has a bread shop. Sara is 40 years old, lives in Patzun. She has 7 children of whom one is already married, 2 have graduated and 4 are studying in school. Her business is a bread shop and her children help. She sells 3 days a week on market days. She has had her business for 20 years. With the help of her husband she has been able to overcome and now has the need to acquire a loan to be able to buy raw materials. As Easter week approaches (an important festival in Guatemala) for many it is the custom to buy a lot of bread, and so her business has a high demand. Sara’s dream is to give a house to her children and to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raw materials for making bread

loans.name: Zully Elsa

texts.es:
Zully es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Zully es casada, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Zully tiene una tienda de repuestos de carro en su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Zully tiene 2 unidades que realizan transporte publico.
Zully necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de motor para su carro.
Los sueños de Zully son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener suficiente rentas para su vejez.
texts.en:
Zully is a member of the Azucenas Communal Bank.

Zully is a 52-year-old married mother with 2 children. She has an auto parts shop in her home, which is open every day. Additionally, she owns two public transportation vehicles.

Zully needs a 2,000 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing an engine for her car. She dreams of her children becoming professionals, and of having enough income to live off of during her old age.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase car engine

loans.name: Liana Del Carmen

texts.es: Liana Del Carmen tiene 48 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, además de esto ella también vender productos de plata y oro. Pues busca la forma de sobrevivir para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Ella dio inicio a este negocio con fondos propios, pues ella trabajaba como supervisora de una bodega, debido al recorte de personal que hubo ella se quedo sin trabajo, pues fue así que decide ofrecer ciertos productos como cremas, colonias y así la mayoría de de sus clientes le hicieron la fama que ella es una excelente vendedora. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo pues así comprara talcos, cremas, pintura de uñas, pinturas de labios. Sueña con tener su propia tienda en donde ofrezca sus productos.
texts.en:
Liana Del Carmen is 48 years old. She sells cosmetics. She also sells silver and gold products. She looks for the way to survive in order to pay the household expenses. She started this business with her own funds. She worked as a supervisor in a convenience store. Due to the cut back in personnel, she was left without work. That is how she decided to sell certain products like creams, colognes, and such. Most of her customers gave her the reputation of being an excellent saleslady. That is why she is requesting this loan for working capital. She will buy powders, creams, nail polish, and lipstick. She dreams of having her own store where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “CORAZON D. JESUS”

“CORAZON D. JESUS” es una alcancía comunal integrada por 11 mujeres que a través D. sus esfuerzos han podido sacar adelante a sus familias D. la mejor manera que han podido.

María es parte D. esta alcancía comunal, a sus 48 años D. edad es madre soltera D. 3 hijos.  Años atrás María decidió dedicarse a la venta D. productos nutricionales, negocio que la ayudó mucho para cubrir los gastos D. su hogar, e incluso logró comprarse una computadora como herramienta para la educación D. sus hijos, pasaron unos años y su la mayor D. sus hijas empezó a darle una utilidad adicional a su computadora, entonces empezó a usarla para el servicio D. tipeo e impresiones.
María también se dedica a dar servicios D. buffet, al ofrecer sus productos naturales a diferentes zonas en la que vive, ha conocido a muchas personas las cuales en ocasiones tienen eventos como, bodas, bautizos, cumpleaños, etc. y ella vio en ello la oportunidad D. ofrecerles el servicio D. buffet al preparar el almuerzo o cena a los invitados D. dichos eventos.

María sueña con ver terminar a todos sus hijos la carrera que han elegido, también con tener una gran librería en la que se dedicaría todo el tiempo.
texts.en:
"Corazon D. Jesus" (Heart of Jesus) is a community bank formed by 11 women who through their efforts have been able to advance their families in the best way that they have been able.

Maria is part of this community bank. At 48, she is the single mother of three children. Years ago, Maria decided to sell nutritional products, a business that helped her very much in covering her household expenses, and she even succeeded in buying a computer as a tool for the education of her children. Some years passed, and her oldest daughter began to give the computer an additional use -- she began to use it for a typing and printing service.

Maria also provides buffet services. She offers her natural products in the different areas near where she lives. She has known many people who occasionally have events such as weddings, baptisms, birthdays, etc., and she saw in this the opportunity to offer buffet services, preparing the lunch or dinner for the guests at these events.

Maria dreams of having all her children complete their studies for the careers that they have chosen; she also dreams of having a big bookstore in which she would work full time.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Praxides

texts.en:
Praxides Namang’ale is 31 years old, is married, and is blessed with four children. She is quiet, humbled and a straightforward talker. She runs a hotel (restaurant) in Nambale, Busia District. She started this business in 2001 after her tailoring business failed.

Praxides would like a loan of Ksh 20,000 which she would like to invest in her hotel business and increase her daily food stock. Her future plan is to venture into a retail business and increase her income.

loans.use: To increase the daily food stock of her restaurant

loans.name: Phebe Potutan Group

texts.en:
Phebe P. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 39 years old. Phebe is the group leader for a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of the other group member, if the other one is delinquent or defaults.

Phebe is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Phebe owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Phebe has been engaged in her business for over 5 years, and she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Phebe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phebe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Phebe is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Phebe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mildred Patricia

texts.es:
En Malambo una tierra fundada por indígenas bajo el mando del cacique que lleva su nombre, vive Mildred R. D. 35 años, ella  tiene una farmacia donD. venD. medicamentos en general, como antigripales, purgantes y analgésicos. Como en los ambientes tropicales  es muy común  que aparezcan enfermedades virales, gripales y diarreicas, y a la farmacia con mucha frecuencia le solicitan medicamentos ordenados por los médicos  para este fin, ella está aplicando a su primer credito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor D. $1.500.000 para comprar antigripales, analgésicos y purgantes principalmente. 
Su negocio nació hace mas D. un año aprovechando la experiencia D. su hermano, quien se desempeña hace mas D. 15 como farmaceuta y le ayudó a conseguir los créditos iniciales para poner en marcha su negocio, y aun la sigue asesorando.  Mildred espera que además D. tener la línea D. droguería, pueda también implementar sus conocimientos D. salud e higiene cosmética, surtiendo en esta línea y adquiriendo poco a poco  equipos especializados para estos tratamientos. 
El principal desafío que se le ha presentado en algunas ocasiones, es que ha perdido ventas por no tener ciertos medicamentos, porque la farmacia requiere tener D. todo un poco para responder a la comunidad.
Mildred es una mujer trabajadora, tambien obtiene ingresos adicionales como auxiliar fisioterapeuta visitando empresas y es muy conocida en su barrio Bellavista, muy cerca al parque la Convivencia D. Malambo, donD. se promueve la cultura del buen   trato con madres comunitarias y los niños D. esta comunidad,
por eso se presentan muestras teatrales, artísticas y culturales.
texts.en:
Malambo is named after the chief of the indigenous people who founded the town. This is where 35 year old Mildred R. lives. She manages a pharmacy where she sells general medicines such as influenza remedies, laxatives, and analgesics. Viral illnesses, influenza, and diarrhea are very common in tropical environments so her pharmacy receives many orders for medicines prescribed by doctors. Mildred is applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the amount of 1,500,000 COP to buy primarily influenza remedies, laxatives, and analgesics.

She started her business more than a year ago in order to take advantage of her brother’s experience. He worked as a pharmacist for more than 15 years and helped her secure the loans needed to start her business. Mildred continues to receive advice from him. She hopes to have a chain of drugstores so that she can utilize her knowledge of health, hygiene, and cosmetics. In order to do this, she wants to gradually acquire specialized equipment to proviD. these treatments. Her main challenge is not having certain medications, which has resulted in a loss of sales on a few occasions. Pharmacies are required to have a little bit of everything in order to respond to the community.

Mildred is a hardworking woman who earns extra income working as an assistant physiotherapist. She visits businesses and is well-known in her neighborhood of Bellavista, which is near Convivencia Park in Malambo. This community is known for promoting a culture that encourages the good treatment of mothers and their children. The area is also recognized for its theatrical, artistic, and cultural events.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase influenza remedies, laxatives, and analgesics

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 42 year old man living in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with four children and looks after a family with six people. William runs a retail shop and has been in the business for seven years now and he says he has no major hardships in doing retailing. Before the retail business, William was a fish monger like most people in his village since they are near Lake Albert. William is also a farmer; he aims at getting food for family to eat in his subsistence mode of agriculture. This is William’s first loan cycle at HOFOKAM and he intends to purchase sugar, salt, soap and domestic items for selling in his shop.

loans.use: purchasing sugar, salt, rice, soap for reselling in his shop.

loans.name: Atweta Evas

texts.en:
They say that hard work pays, and a very determined Atweta Evas N. has gained from the fruits of her hard work having started up her hotel (restaurant) enterprise six years ago in Ibanda. So far, she has no regrets.

Due to Evas’ good management, esteemed customer care, and the fact that she also maintains high levels of hygiene, the business has maintained customers for a long time, thus creating a good market for her hotel.

With this loan, Evas wants to put in place good furniture and also buy foodstuffs for the hotel. This will enable her to earn more profit and be able to cater for herself and for her family and children’s requirements; she is very optimistic of achieving a self-sustaining life.

With buying in bulk, the prices are somewhat reduced and this works to Evas' advantage.

loans.use: To buy more furniture and foodstuffs for her hotel

loans.name: Ladia Violeta

texts.es:
La Señora Ladia F. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus bellos paisajes, sus iglesias, los 4 ríos que bañan la ciudad y su gente que es cálida y amble.

La Señora. Ladia tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos quienes se encuentren de 20, 17, y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio, su esposo es jubilado de la policía, gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado tener su casa propia.

Nuestra socia es empresaria de productos Yanbal, trabajo que realiza hace 4 años, vende sus  productos  todos los días ya que cuenta con una oficina propia.

Es nuestra socia hace 3 años y todos los crédito le han beneficiado para crecer en su negocio,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en incrementar su negocio y así ir creciendo ya que ese es su sueño.
texts.en:
Ms Ladia F. is a member of the Banco Comunal Sol Naciente (Rising Sun Communal Bank): she lives in the city of Cuenca, a place renowned for its beautiful landscapes, its churches, the 4 rivers it is washed by and its warm and kind inhabitants. Ladia is 38 years old, she is married and has 3 children aged 20, 17 and 15. Her eldest son is a university student, the other two children go to school, and her husband is a retired policeman; the joint working efforts of her husband and herself have allowed them to succeed in buying a house of their own. This borrower is a selling agent for Yanbal (a SouthAmerican company similar to Avon): she has been working in this capacity for 4 years, and she sells her products every day, as she has an shop of her own. She has been one of our members for 3 years, and through every loan she has succeeded in making her activity grow; this new loan she is requesting will be used to further improve her activity, thus making it possible for her job to continue growing, which is what she dreams of.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy make-up, perfumes, creams and costume jewellery.

loans.name: Mahutin Gilles

texts.fr: A. Mahutin Gilles est né le 21 Juillet 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Gilles vit depuis une trentaine d'année à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Gilles est marié à YEHOSSOU  Armelle, une commerçante. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Gilles vit ensemble avec sa famille à Lokokoukoumè. Gilles a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir aux différents besoins de ses enfants et faire face à ses charges, Gilles vend des racines et plantes médicinales dans sa boutique. Gilles  s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Gilles exerce cette activité depuis seize ans et a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'il a bien remboursés. Gilles désire agrandir plus son activité et mieux répondre aux différentes exigences de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Gilles sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Mahutin Gilles A. was born on 21st July 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Gilles has lived for around thirty years in Lokokoukoumè, in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. He is married to Armelle Yehossou, a trader. The couple has four children who are all at school. Gilles lives with his family in Lokokoukoumè. He left school at secondary level. In order to provide for the various needs of his children and to cover his expenses, Gilles sells medicinal roots and plants in his shop. He gets his supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. He has been carrying out this activity for the past sixteen years and has already had two loans from ALIDé, both of which he repaid in full. Gilles would like to expand his business and respond better to the various demands of his customers; for this reason he is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicinal leaves, plants and bark

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia D. is currently in the business of selling dresses, pairs of trousers and bedsheets. She is requesting a loan to stock shoes and saddles to sell. 

Lucia is 31 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a supermarket.

loans.use: Stock shoes and saddles to sell

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  "Leonardo"; es travesti y todos la conocen con el apelativo de Nancy, La srta. tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera. La socia es cosmetóloga de profesión, y trabaja en la peluquería “Nancy”  esta peluquería es de su propiedad; ella siempre implementa su peluqueria y le gusta innovar, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This client is a member of the “VIRGEN DE CHAPI” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Miss Leonarda, nicknamed Nancy, is 49 years old, a cross-dresser and single. She is a professional cosmetologist and works in a beauty salon called “Nancy” that she owns; she always makes sure the salon is well-stocked and she likes to innovate. She is requesting the loan to buy beauty salon supplies. She is grateful for the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia T. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Lilia is married and has five school-aged children. Lilia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from GDMPC, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Lilia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding the business

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en:
Rabia lives in a small city of Punjab called Kausr, famous in Pakistan for its leather industry. She is 27 years old, divorced and doesn’t have children. She lives in a three-room brick house with her brothers. She keeps herself busy making embroidered clothes for her neighboring clients. She is a skillful lady. She knows different embroidery techniques and applies those techniques on clothes to give them a new look.  She receives regular orders due to the quality of work. Both her brothers adopted the embroidery work as a profession just like their sister Rabia. They have their own shop in the market where they receive regular orders and complete embroidered dresses to earn their income.  

Rabia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery items such as clothes, beads, sketches and colored thread in bulk and makes embroidered dresses to sell to different shops to earn a living. She is a new client of Asasah and is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her. 

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Rabia.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items in bulk quantity

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María es una pequeña comerciante que ha venido trabajando, con financiamiento para lograr la inversión de su pulpería. Que inicio desde hace varios años lo cual lo hizo con apoyo de su esposo.

Lo que necesita es invertir más en productos de alimentos, ya que es el que se vende más. Con los préstamos ha venido creciendo ya que comenzó con poco lo que Afodenic ha sido una puerta a su economía. 
Lo que comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, bidón de aceite, lácteos, golosinas, gaseosas. Logrando así vender más y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is a small businesswoman who has been working with loans to achieve success with her grocery store.  She started it several years ago with help from her husband.

What she needs most is to invest in more food items because these are her best sellers.  With loans she has been growing because she started out with very little and Afodenic has been a pathway to better economy.

She will buy: rice, beans, sugar, a large container of cooking oil, dairy products, sweets and soft drinks thereby attaining better sales and meeting customer demand.

loans.use: To buy basic grains like: rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, sweets and others thus obtaining better sales.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma L., from the town of Banga, is 27 years old, married, and has two children aged six and four. A rice farmer, she learned to farm from her parents, who were both farmers. Her husband, also a farmer, does the major farming duties while she helps keep the farm free of weeds and pests. She also takes care of their two children and hopes to be able to provide for all their needs.

Emma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BADEGNA sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans les familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le  quartier Massabla-coura de la ville de  BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce. 
Dans l’intention d’acheter plus de produits pour satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce  nouveau prêt,  DJENEBA D., la présidente du groupe  compte acheter, une importante quantité de différentes sortes de condiments alimentaires auprès des grossistes à Bamako.  Elle effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le grand marché de Bougouni et à domicile, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt  elle compte obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans l’activité et l’autre partie dans les frais d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The women of Badegna Group are all married. On average, they are 35 years old and have six children.  They live in large traditional families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. They live in the neighborhood of Massabla-Coura of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They have known each other through business relations.

In order to buy more products to meet the demand from their customers, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their sixth group loan, after having properly repaid all their previous loans. Djeneba D., the group's president, will use her new loan to buy a large quantity of various kinds of food condiments. She will buy her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako and retail them for cash or credit at the great market in Bougouni as well as from her home. Her customers are usually women.

Thanks to this loan, Djeneba D. expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs. She will invest it partly in her business and spend it partly on her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: 0305013-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh Group

texts.en:
Tam T. T. (75) is a 35-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa.  Tam is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 0305013-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh (0305013-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh).


Tam is married and has two infant children.  To make a living, Tam operates a family member's business providing food services to local community members.  Tam has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, Tam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Tam from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Nhung (129) is a 45-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  B. Thij Cuc (9) is a 37-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  L. T. Lien (126) is a 32-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  L. T. Lan (124) is a 31-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


5.  N. T. Thuy (57) is a 28-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


6.  T. T. Tuy (143) is a 38-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tam T. T. (75) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Tam là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0305013-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh (0305013-Dai Long-Hoang Thanh).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ thực phẩm cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tam thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tam kiếm được khoảng 3,500,000 VND.  Vào 2004, Tam đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tam đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. Nhung (129) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  B. Thij Cuc (9) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  L. T. Lien (126) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  L. T. Lan (124) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  N.  T. Thuy (57) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  T. T. Tuy (143) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munkhtsetseg is 33 years old and lives with her 2 children and husband. They all live in a wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband operates a taxi service in the city, and her elder son attends a secondary school, while the younger son goes to kindergarten. She used to work for a clothing factory as a tailor for 13 years, and during those years she gained a lot of experience. Therefore, in 2009 she started her own tailoring business.

 Now she has her regular customers already, and she is getting busy now, because of New Year is coming soon therefore she wants to hire someone to help her with the business. Munkhtsetseg is planning to expand her business. She is requesting 1.000.000 MNT loan to purchase some fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.use: purchase some fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah T. L. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has one child aged twelve years old, whom they hope to give a good education up to the university level. Her business is located at a busy market in Kakamega. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it is known as the sugar belt region.

She has a boutique in which she sells children's wear and women's dresses. She has been in this business for five years now. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers, hence customers are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 49,000 to buy more clothes to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers, especially during this festive season. In future, she hopes to open a bigger boutique. She describes herself as an ambitious lady.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Myasar

texts.en:
Myasar from Marka, Amman is a young 23-year-old entrepreneurial woman. She started her business from home selling home-cleaning products, and then she rented a small shop. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to decorate her shop and to buy additional materials.

Myasar's mother, who appears on the right of Myasar in the photo, is helping her to manage her business. Myasar's aspiration is to build a strong reputation for her shop and increase her sales.

loans.use: To decorate her shop and to buy additional materials

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: Guitar Making, Sari-sari (general) store and food vending businesses.  Her husband Gregorio A., who is 51 years old years old, works as a Guitar Maker to earn his living. They have 8 children who are 17 to 30 years old - 4 of them have their own family, 3 employed children to help the family and 1 is currently going to school.  

Apolinaria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Apolinaria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 34,000 PHP, thus increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing 13,000 PHP which she intends to use as more funds for her business operations so that she could continue to save up for the future, education of her child and for home repairs.  

Apolinaria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Funds for her business operations.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama S. est une femme de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle a une ancienneté de 04 ans et demi dans le Banc Villageois de SANGHE DOUKA et y a reçu 09 prêts.

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et caprine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Et comme activité secondaire elle fait la vente de beignets. 

Son crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité en augmentant les têtes de bêtes à emboucher. 

Avec le bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle parvient à satisfaire les besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Adama S., age 40, is married and the mother of eight children. She's been a member of the "Banc Villageois" of SANGHE DOUKA for four-and-a-half years, and already benefited from nine loans.

She's been raising sheep and goats for more than ten years. She also sells doughnuts as a secondary business. Her loan will enable her to better expand her business, by increasing the number of animals she raises.

With her profits, she manages to provide for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet N. is thirty two years old, married and has two children aged thirteen years old and eight years old. She hopes to provide her children with education through the university level. She owns a hardware store named Ghemt Hardware and Electronics. She sells such items as paints, cement, plumbing fittings and electricals. Her business is located at Githunguri and she is served by the Kitengela branch. She has been in this business for the last two years now and has managed to hire one employee. She says that this business is profitable and that the major challenge she has is poor roads which delay delivery of the items she sells. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy a donkey and cart to help her deliver items to customers. She hopes to be a wholesaler, open branches in other parts of Kenya and in the future, go outside Kenya. She describes herself as a believer and she knows that with God, everything is possible.

loans.use: Purchase of Donkey and Cart for transportation of goods sold

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: El señor Máximo se dedica a la venta de accesorios de  vehículos desde hace dos años, anteriormente solamente comerciaba los accesorios y actualmente ya elabora fundas para los vehículos artesanalmente los trabajos los realiza a pedido y también al por mayor, su negocio esta ubicado al borde del rio donde los transportistas traen sus vehículos para el lavado, momento que aprovecha para la venta de sus productos, vive en casa de propiedad de su prima en alquiler, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra por mayor de accesorios para vehículo, es una persona muy trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Maximo has been selling vehicle accessories for 2 years.  Previously he sold only the accessories, but now he makes vehicle covers by hand.  He does this work based on prior orders, and also sells the covers at wholesale.  His business is located on the edge of the river where the taxi drivers bring their vehicles to be washed, and he takes advantage of this time to sell his products.  He lives in a house that he rents from his cousin.  He will use the proceeds from this loan to purchase more vehicle accessories at wholesale.  He is a very hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle accessories

loans.name: Uniendo Fuerzas Group

texts.es: Victoria es integrante D. la Alcancía comunal “Uniendo Fuerzas” en donD. 07 personas emprendedoras D. su propio destino se reúnen desD.  hace 6 años para conseguir un capital D. trabajo D. acuerdo a sus economías y estilo D. vida.  Victoria a sus 63 años D. edad es casada y trabaja hace 25 años vendiendo golosinas en su propia carretilla frente a un centro educativo D. su comunidad, en donD. venD. diversas golosinas y bebidas. Junto a su esposo que tiene una pequeña carpintería en su vivienda, victoria es conocida como Vicky solicito este nuevo préstamo para invertir en su carretilla y surtirla con variedad D. golosinas para reciente temporada D. escolar pues recientemente se iniciaron las clases D. manera regular. Su seño es tener un negocio formal e implementar su pequeño negocio D. venta D. golosinas y así ayudar a sus hijos. Vicky participa activamente en su alcancía comunal y esta agradecida D. tener este nuevo capital  y le entusiasma  el poder ahorrar para su futuro. Nuestra Alcom Uniendo fuerzas posa en compañía D. sus pequeños hijos, no nos acompaño la socia Mariluz H. por la distancia D. su centro D. labores.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the “Joining Forces” cooperative bank, where 7 individuals in charge of their own destiny have met for the past 6 years to obtain working capital befitting their financial situations and lifestyles.  Victoria, 63 years of age, is married and, for the past 25 years, has manned a stand in front of a school in her community where she sells snacks and beverages.

Together with her husband, who runs a small carpentry workshop in their house, Victoria (known as Vicky), requests a new loan to invest further into her business.  The funds will allow her to stock her stand with a variety of snacks for the new school year, as classes just started again on a regular basis.

Her dream is to have an established business so she can help her children.  Vicky is an active participant in her cooperative bank, and is thankful for this opportunity to access new working capital.  She is enthusiastic about being able to save for her future.

Our “Joining Forces” cooperative bank members pose along with their small children, except for Mariluz H., due to the distant area where her work is located.

loans.use: to purchase snacks for her business.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Crecencia Margarita H. O., tiene 38 años de edad, cursó los tres años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos, 1 de las cuales esta estudiando, ella se dedica a la artesanía, al bordado de blusas tipicas, tiene ya 10 años de experiencia, ya que inicio este oficio cuando tenia 15 años, y espera mejorar para tener mas capital y mas estabilidad de vida, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la albañileria. 

Decide organizar un grupo con el fin de solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para compra de hilo y con esto incrementar su capital de trabajo. Las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas como son la crianza de animales y la elaboración de bordados.
texts.en:
Crecencia Margarita H. O. is 38 years old and has a third grade education. She has three children, one of whom is in school. Crecencia engages in crafts, embroidering traditional blouses. She has ten years of experience and started in this trade when she was 15 years old. Crecencia hopes to improve by having more capital and greater stability in life. She has the support of her husband, who works as a mason.

Crecencia decided to organize a group so that she could request a loan to buy thread and increase her operating capital. The other members of the group engage in different business activities such as raising animals and producing embroideries.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery thread.

loans.name: Kennya Joseth

texts.es: Kennya Joseth tiene 23 años. Su actividad es la venta ofrecer los servicios de cyber. Tiene más  17 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy difícil pero ha logrado superar los desafíos que enfrenta. Cuando inicio fue con fondos propios, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona responsable y que disfruta de su trabajo, su hijo menor de edad está a su cargo. Este financiamiento es para la compra de muebles para computadora, abanicos, computadoras y cables ya que necesita ofrecerles a sus clientes el mejor servicio. Desea incrementar su inventario y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Kennya Joseth, age 23, sells internet services.  She has had this business for 17 years.  It has been very difficult, but she has managed to overcome that challenges she faces.  She started with her own funds.

She has always been characterized as a responsible person, and she enjoys her work.  Her young child is under her care.

This loan is to buy computer furniture, fans, computers, and cables.  She needs these things to provide her customers with the best service.  She wishes to increase her inventory and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy computer furniture, fans, computers, and cables.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se llama RENACER; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Martha, la socia tiene 49 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene una hija de 26 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades con la compra y venta de cosméticos, la socia lleva sus catálogos a las instituciones públicas y privadas y ofrece sus productos que consisten en la venta de shampoo, cremas, colonias, maquillajes, bisutería en general. La socia requiere el préstamo a razón de tener un capital de trabajo para poder pagar los pedido y esperar a que sus clientes le den en partes una ves que el producto llegue, la socia es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, ella desea lo mejor para su hija y es por eso que sigue adelante con su pequeña empresa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cosméticos, cremas y productos de belleza para la venta. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called RENACER and is located in the Huanchac district, part of the province and department of Cusco.

Martha is 49 years old and single, with a 26 year old daughter.  She buys and sells cosmetics by showing her catalogs at public and private institutions.  Her products include shampoo, creams, colognes, makeup, and general costume jewelry.   She needs this loan to increase her working capital to be able to pay for orders and later collect from her customers.

Martha is very hard working and active person who wants the best for her daughter, so she continues ahead with her small company.  She is very grateful and promises to be disciplined about making her payments.

loans.use: to pay for orders and later collect from her customers

loans.name: Jetty

texts.en: Jetty sells greens. She is 30 years old and married. Jetty borrowed a loan to stock more greens to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with any extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, tiene la edad de 47  años, está viudo, el  vive con sus 2 hijos que son su prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de insumos para asistir la siembra del chile que está realizando.  El está realizando este nuevo proyecto porque está dejando ganancias para su bienestar y poder seguir adelante con su familia. El quiere es aumentar la cantidad de terreno sembrado y así conformar una próxima buena cosecha para crecer como productor de chile y tener un futuro con un mejor bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Edwin is 47 years old, a widower, and he lives with his two children on his own property. He plans on purchasing materials with his loan to help him maintain his planned chili plantation. He has started this new project because he wants to keep some savings fro his own well-being and to be able to support his family. He wants to expand his farm land area and to secure a good future harvest of chilies and to have better future with his family. This is the first loan which he receives from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). He has not had other previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur has granted him a loan with greater benefits and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to start a chili plantation.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Jappo Jappalante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Jappo Jappalante est créé en Septembre 2007  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 23 femmes qui toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Marième (assise en deuxième position de la  gauche vers la droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle a 03 autres membres de sa famille en charge.

Elle vend des tissus. Activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de 16 ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en tissus.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et  de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire.
texts.en:
The Jappo Jappalante group was created in September 2007 on the day the "village bank" was inaugurated. It is made up of 23 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They are all small-scale retailers.  

Madame Marième (seated second, left to right) is the leader of the group. She is 37, married, and the mother of four children. She is caring for three other members of her family.
