She sells cloth, a business she has been in for more than 16 years. With this loan she intends to stock up on cloth. The profit from her business will allow her to put aside savings and help her husband cover food and school fees.

loans.use: to stock up on cloth.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Rehema has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Rehema sells her products at the market —  wholesale and retail. She has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Rehema are defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start buying bananas direct from farmers and also to sell only wholesale. Rehema lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Wilber Javier

texts.es: Wilber es un joven de 28 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 16 años. El cuenta con un puesto de prendas de vestir en una de las avenidas más concurridas de su localidad. Tiene clientes establecidos que están muy contentos con la calidad de su servicio y productos. Wilber solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisetas, ropa interior, camisolas, trajes para niños entre otros.  El es un cliente muy responsable pues el crédito que nuestra entidad le concedió anteriormente, lo canceló sin problemas. Esta inversión permitirá el desarrollo económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilber is a 28-year-old young man who has made a living selling clothes for 16 years. He has a garment stall on one of the most trafficked avenues in his town. He has established customers that are very happy with the quality of his service and his products. 

Wilber is requesting a loan to purchase pants, shirts, underwear, camisoles and children’s clothing among other things. He is a very responsible client. He repaid the previous loan that our organization gave him without any problems. This investment will allow for the economic development of his family.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, underwear, camisoles and children’s clothing among other things.

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en:
Elvisa is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Elvisa has a retail shop that sells snacks, biscuits, breads & beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Elvisa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elvisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
La Joven Rosalba tiene la edad de 19 años, solo estudio la prepararia y es soltera.
Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de un año asistio a un curso en su comunidad en el cual le enseñaron a elaborar manualidades con papel crepe y como aprendio bien a decidido iniciar a vender recuerdos para fiestas, XV años, bautizos, bodas y cumpleaños, ella nos dice que trabajara sobre pedidios y que necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de listones, papel crepe, hilos, pegamento, palillos, silicon, papel mache, unicel u hojas blancas para la elaboracion de sus manualidades y posteriormente venderlas.
Ella nos dice que espera tener mucho exito con su negocio ya que hasta el dia de hoy no existe nadie que venda este tipo de articulos en su comunidad, tambien nos dice que espera que sus productos pronto agarre popularidad para asi poder tener mas clientes y hacer crecer su  negocio.
Rosalba esta contenta ya que con este credito inicara a trabajar con su propio negocio y envia un saludo a la fundacion y mucho agradecimiento por el apoyo que le han dado.
texts.en:
Rosalba is a young woman who is 19 years of age. She is single and only has a preparatory school education.

Rosalba says that a little more than a year ago, she took a course that was offered in her community in which she learned how to make handicrafts out of crepe paper. She learned this craft so well that she started selling souvenirs for parties, quinceañeras, baptisms, weddings, and birthdays. Rosalba says that she works according to orders that she receives. She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of ribbons, crepe paper, yarn, glue, sticks, silicon, paper-mache, styrofoam, and butcher paper for making handicrafts that she can sell later.

Rosalba says that she hopes to have great success with her business. To this day, there is no one else who sells these types of items in her community. In addition, she hopes that her products gain popularity so that she can attract more customers and grow her business.

Rosalba is pleased with this loan so that she can start these orders for her business. She sends her greetings to Fundación Realidad and expresses great appreciation for the support that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy materials for making and selling handicrafts.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is married and her husband deals in scrap. He provides scrap to other scrap dealers and to different factories. His business is doing well and he needs continuous investment to fulfill the orders on time. Bushra is a seamstress who sews clothes for her neighborhood clients for a profit. She learned this art from her mother and now she earns a reasonable income every month. This income helps her pay the utility bills.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy scrap in bulk to be able to fulfill the client orders on time and earn more profits. He has good experience in his business and has been operating it for the past 13 years. Bushra is confident about the positive growth of her husband’s business after the loan investment. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan from Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bushra.

loans.use: To buy scrap in bulk

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Maximo, tiene la edad 65 de años, está casado y vive con su señora esposa que es su prioridad. El pretende con el crédito comprar insumos para la asistencia de almacigo. El cuenta con el almacigo ya sembrado y necesita asistirlo para así obtener de el un muy buen resultado en calidad para satisfacer a sus compradores. El quiere generar las mayores ganancias y así poderle ofrecer a su señora esposa un mejor futuro mejor y mejorar su bienestar familiar.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Maximo is 65 years old, married, and lives with his wife, who is his priority. He intends with the loan to purchase supplies for tending to a seedbed. He has the seedbed already planted and needs to tend to it so that he may get very good results from it, in order to satisfy his buyers. He wants to generate greater earnings and thus be able to offer to his esteemed wife a better future, and improve the family's well-being. 

This is his first loan received from Fudecosur. He had not had other loans previously at state banks, but Fudecosur has provided him the loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for tending to a seedbed.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Alma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverage. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chum, a 28-year-old married woman, resides in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Mrs. Chum has a life partner in her husband who works as a security guard for a company. They have two children who are attending a local state school. 

Mrs. Chum has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Mrs. Chum and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise. With the remaining funds, Mrs. Chum will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. 

In the future, she hopes that the increased income will allow her to build a small store in front of her house to sell things for extra profit and support her children to finish a university degree.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets to raise and to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 66 years old and is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is a hardworking businesswoman who is 39 years old. She is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. She has been running a cafeteria for the last six years to support her family. She also rents houses to earn extra income. Rhoda has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. She has employed one person to help her to manage her business. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to renovate her business premises.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises.

loans.name: Ingizar

texts.en:
Ingizar is from the village of Kharajalari in the Kartli region. She is 62 years old and lives with her family: her husband, Javanshir; their 36-year-old son; their daughter-in-law, and their 12-year-old granddaughter, who goes to school.

Ingizar and her husband earn a living through vegetable growing. They own agricultural land with a total area of 1,500 sq. meters. The family grows greens on the land. Ingizar sells harvested greens in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. Ingizar’s son is a worker in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,200 GEL.  

Ingizar requested credit for diversifying the family’s agricultural activities. She plans to purchase calves. She will feed them during winter months and sell for a higher price in spring. The family will have more income. Ingizar plans to make some savings from the earned profit, as she wants to renovate the family house in the nearest future.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with two children who are in school. Her husband is businessman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Asha has operated as a tailor for the past five years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, in which there is low demand during some months of the year. She dreams of expanding her business.

With a loan of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase fabrics and service her sewing machine. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its low loan interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and service her sewing machine.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is engaged in agriculture. He keeps cattle and cultivates the land. Tigran lives together with his wife and three children. The current income he earns is not enough to sustain the family properly. 

Tigran would like to develop his agriculture business and get more income. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase pigs and corn seeds, and also renovate the barn. 

This loan will help Tigran to earn additional income, pay for his children’s education, and ensure a sustainable future for them.

loans.use: to pay for pigs, corn seeds, and barn renovation.

loans.name: Wechinia B Group

texts.en:
Mary is the facilitator of the Wechinia B group. Mary and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

Mary joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on that land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 36 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture, selling specialty food products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in the expansion of the business. In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 41 years old and married with two children between the ages of 16 and 20 years old. Antoinette has a sewing business. Her business is well organized and clean. She works from 7am until 8pm every day and has eight years of experience.

Antoinette has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by buying more clothes for sewing. With the profit, she will be able to buy more food for her family and save money.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sewing.

loans.name: Sann

texts.en: Sann, 58, is married, and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers. Two of her children are employed, one is a blacksmith and another one is a garment worker. Due to the difficulty in farming work, Sann is requesting a loan of 750 USD to purchase oxen to yoke in order to plow her farmland for growing rice. In the future, she would like to renew her house and support her children to study higher.

loans.use: to purchase oxen to yoke in order to plow her farmland

loans.name: Las Lupitas Group

texts.es:
El Grupo las Lupitas esta integrado por 6 mujeres muy alegres y trabajadoras las cuales dia con dia trabajan en sus propios negocios para sacar adelente a sus familias y poder dar a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida y estudios.

La señora Maria Elena es uno de los integrantes de este grupo tiene la edad de 30 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, se encuentra casada con el señor Luis que tiene el oficio de trailero, ellos tiene 1 hijo de nombre Luis Angel que tiene 2 años de edad. 

Doña Maria Elena platica que desde hace 3 años inicio con su negocio de venta de Ropa porque quiere sacar adelante a su hijo ya que piensa que la situacion economica es cada vez mas dificil y de esta manera puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y ambos sacar adelante a su familia, trabajando muy duro.

Ella comenta que lleva a  cabo sus ventas de ropa  saliendo a caminar casa por casa, muestra sus ropa  a sus amigas y vecinas  de su comunidad y si es de su agrado le compran sus productos, ademas comenta que en ocasiones sus clientas le hacen pedidos y ella cuando va a surtirse le traie los pedidos. Tambien comenta que se encuentra muy contenta porque ya es muy conocida en la comunidad por su negocio de venta de Ropa.

Doña Maria Elena necesita este credito para la compra de blusas, camisas, calsetines, pantalones, faldas, playeras, vestidos, shorts, licras para posteriormente ponerlas a la venta.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere pues quiere en un futuro rentar un local y ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Victoria cocina economica
lourdes venta de cosmeticos
Magdalena venta de ropa 
Norma cocina economica
Virginia venta de cosmeticos
texts.en:
The group "Las Lupitas" is made up of 6 very happy and hardworking women who work each day in their own businesses to get ahead with their families, and provide a better quality of life and education to their children.  

Maria Elena is one of the members of this group.  She is 30 years old, and has a high school education.  She is married to Luis, who is a truck driver.  They have a son, named Luis Angel, who is two years old. Maria Elena tells us that she started a business selling clothing 3 years ago in order to support her son, because it seemed to her that the economic situation continues to deteriorate.  This way she can help her husband with the household expenses, and with both of them working hard they can get ahead.  

Maria Elena tells us that she makes her clothing sales by going door-to-door.  She displays her clothing to her friends and neighbors in her community, and if they like her products they buy them.  In addition, she says that occasionally her customers will make orders, and she will go out to buy clothing and deliver the orders to them.  Also, she comments that she is very content, because she is already very well known in the community for her business selling clothing.

Maria Elena needs this loan to buy blouses, shirts, socks, pants, skirts, T-shirts, dresses, shorts and lycra leggings to later offer for sale.

She hopes that with this investment her business will prosper, because in the future she wants to rent a store and provide her children with a better quality of life.  

The other members of the group are:

Victoria - food sales
Lourdes - cosmetics sales
Magdalena - clothing sales
Norma - food sales
Virginia - cosmetics sales

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, socks, pants, skirts, T-shirts, dresses, shorts and lycra leggings

loans.name: A Trabajar Group

texts.es: ¡Saludos desde Perú! Este es el grupo A Trabajar. Paulina, presidenta del grupo, es casada y tiene 1 hijo pero esta en el extranjero, vive con su esposo, con su nuera y sus 3 nietas. Paulina se dedica a la venta pulpa de cangrejo, ya que trabaja con su esposo. Comenzó hace 20 años ya que su esposo era taxista, no le alcanzaba para los gastos de la casa y por un amigo conoció el negocio. Cuenta con varios clientes en restaurantes y mercados, ya que los vende por mayor. Con el Préstamo va a comprar más cangrejos, ya que quiere mejorar sus ingresos, además tiene varios pedidos que ahora va a poder realizar. El sueño de Paulina es poder crecer ya que tiene planes de ahorrar para poder tener un restaurante. Paulina es la señora que tiene lentes con una casaca verde. Esta muy emocionada y agradecida por que de esta forma va a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! This group is named “A Trabajar”.

Paulina is the group president. She is married and has a son who is currently abroad. Paulina lives with her husband, her daughter-in-law, and her three granddaughters. She and her husband work together selling crab meat. Paulina started working 20 years ago back when her husband was a taxi driver. They were not earning enough household income, but she knew a friend who was in this type of business. Now she has several customers, including restaurants and markets, and sells to them in bulk quantities.

With this loan, Paulina will buy more crabs so that she can improve her earnings. She already has several orders, so she wants to complete them now. Paulina’s dream is to keep growing since she has plans to use her savings to open a restaurant. In the photo, Paulina is the woman wearing glasses and a green jacket. She is very excited and appreciates having the chance to move forward.

loans.use: to buy crabs in bulk quantities.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
After graduating from middle school, Comfort decided to set up her own provision and fabrics shop in Elmina located in the Central Region. The profits from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their children’s school fees. 

Comfort wants to increase her inventory due to a growing number of customers. Unfortunately, she does not have enough working capital. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase an increased amount of Milo, margarine, oil, fabrics, and shoes to meet the demand of her customers. 

Comfort aims at using the profits from her business to support her husband, a carpenter, with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their five children are able to receive a better education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of Milo, margarine, oil, fabrics, and shoes to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Erika Tatiana

texts.es:
Ella es Erika Tatiana vive  en la ciudad de Bogotá desde hace 7 años,tiene 21 años de edad, Estudia  enfermería  en campo alto, eligió  estudiar  enfermería  dada,la vocación de ayudar a los demás, de ser útil de alguna forma  a la comunidad,  la motivación es ayudar a quien en realidad lo necesita, por eso ve en la enfermería  un sitio idóneo para desempeñar esta labor.  
En el momento ella  se encuentra  viviendo con una  hermana, el esposo de la hermana y un sobrino, no cuenta  con un trabajo estable ni vivienda propia, por lo cual  requiere  el  beneficio de kiva para seguir estudiando, afirma que  está feliz y entusiasmada  con los estudios, quiere terminar  la carrera y así poder seguir  surgiendo escalón tras  escalón, no olvidando nunca, que los demás  necesitan del  apoyo que ellalespueda brindar.
texts.en:
Erica Tatiana has lived in the city of Bogotá for 7 years, she is 21 years old. She studies nursing in Campo Alto. She chose to study nursing, the vocation of helping others, she is inclined to be useful in some way to the community. The motivation is to help whom really needs it for this she sees  nursing as an ideal place to carry out this work.

At this time, she lives with her sister, the husband of her sister, and her nephew. She doesn't have a stable job nor her own living for this reason she requires a loan from Kiva to continue studying. She affirms that she is happy and excited with her studies. She wants to finish her degree and so be able to continue emerging step after step, never forgetting that others need the support that she can afford them.

loans.use: to pay a semester's enrollment.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: Sarin, a local farmer from Kampong Cham province, is 58 years old and a widowed mother blessed with one kid. Her main sources of income are from her Jicama planting and her paid-working job. She can earn about 32,000 KHR per day from the business that she has had for ages. This is the first loan for Sarin with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her cash-crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her cash-crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sabougnouma 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  WASSADA, un des villages de Yanfolila, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de  DOMO, 2ème personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  WASSADA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  75.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали  54 года. Он жительница района Хуросон. Курбонали счастливый отец и дедушка. Его жена ухаживает за детьми, внуками и ведет домашнее хозяйство. Курбонали 30 летный дехканин. Он начал заниматься животноводством, когда ему было 24 года. Его на районе все уважает, и от него берет советы для выращивания скота.  Курбонали любит домашних животных и у него была мечта стать опытным и лучшем дехканином. Сейчас Курбонали хочет купить несколько скота, чтобы развиваться дальше и расширить деятельность. У него нет денег для купли скота, и он решил обратиться за кредитом. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему достичь своих целей. Курбоанли верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Для купли несколько скота и расширения деятельности.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monicah is married with four children. Her husband is a lorry driver and distributes cement to various hard wares from Athi Town to Thika Town.

Monicah is a choir member of Kirigu Anglican Church and participates in various community work in Kirigu.

Monicah is a farmer and sells maize, beans, Potatoes and fruits. She has been in this business for more than 33 years. Every month, she is able to make a profit $57 from selling maize to traders in SabaSaba, Muranga, Thika and Nairobi.

loans.use: Monicah would like to buy a plot of land and build rental rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Set up a cafeteria

loans.name: Teina

texts.en: Teina M. is a mother of five children and lives in the Samoan countryside far from town.  She has a talent for weaving and weaves traditional Samoan mats.  She weaves the fine mats that are used in special Samoan celebrations, such as weddings.  Traditionally in Samoa, all women knew how to weave, but now Teina is a rarity.  There is a strong market for her mats, and although it is very time-consuming and difficult work, she is able to sell these fine mats for good prices.  Teina invests the time and diligence in her weaving in order to preserve the traditional Samoan craft and to provide for her large family. She plans to use the loan to buy weaving materials.

loans.use: Buy weaving materials

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy has been married since 1981 and has 1 son and 1 daughter. He has been a fisherman for twenty years. His wife is a housewife and his two children stay at home, too - they had to stop studying, because Thy did not have enough money to support them. Thy and his wife did not have a chance to study because of the war. The family is now asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a fishing net, bamboo and other fishing materials. Thy hopes to sell the fish he catches in the village. He is healthy and loyal, and will therefore be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing fishing net, bamboo and other fishing material

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Ms. Liliana is 21 years old and single. She owns a nursery where she sells all kinds of garden plants. She opened this business more than 3 years ago and she runs it from the yard of her parents' house.

Liliana took over this business from her parents who left it her so she could start generating her own income and pay for her studies. Her parents have another, larger, nursery where they themselves work.

In her city, Compañía Cabañas de Caacupé, there are many nurseries with a large variation of plants, due to the good climate and quality of the soil. Therefore, this line of business is very competitive, but at the same time, there is a large number of customers that come to this city from all over the country to buy plants.

She is requesting a loan to buy rose seeds of different colors and fertilizer to grow the roses. These are in high demand by the customers that visit her store.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

Original description in Spanish:

La señorita Liliana tiene 21 años y es soltera. Posee un viveros dónde vende todo tipo de plantas para jardín, abrió este negocio hace más de 3 años y lo tiene en el predio de la casa de su padre.

Liliana, heredó éste negocio de sus padres quienes dejaron a su cargo la administración del mismo de tal manera de que ella pueda generar sus propios ingresos y poder solventar sus estudios. Sus padres tienen otro vivero más grande en el cual ellos trabajan.

En la ciudad donde reside, Compañía Cabañas de Caacupé, existen una gran cantidad de viveros donde uno puede encontrar variedades de plantas de todo tipo, por el buen clima de la zona, y la buena tierra. Por ello este rubro es bastante competitivo, pero a la vez con una gran afluencia de clientes, pues vienen desde distintos puntos del país para adquirir las plantas de esa ciudad.

Desea un préstamo para comprar semillas de rosas de diferentes colores y abono para plantar rosas, ya que esta es la de mayor demanda por los clientes que visitan su local.

loans.use: To purchase seed for different colors of roses and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 29 years old, married with one child, and she takes care of two orphans. She owns the Magidu and Sons General Merchandise store. Her store specializes in food stuffs, soft drinks and fuel: petro and paraffin. She plans to use her loan to buy more fuel products in larger quantities so she can sell wholesale. Her store sells various commodities that are essential to homes but are not always easily found in the area. She wants a good education for her children and wants to eventually expand the entire business into wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more paraffin and petro for her store

loans.name: Kurvon

texts.en: Kurvon is 34 years old. She has 4 children and lives with her elderly parents. Kurvon has been engaged in trade for over 9 years. Her trade place is located in J. Rasulov, Khujand. Her business is to sell women's and children's clothes. She became a client of MicroInvest in 2005. During her partnership with this organization, she repaid her loans without any delay. Her business is going well, and she has a fast turnover of her goods. From Kiva, she hopes to receive a loan for purchasing winter clothes from Uzbekistan. Now the import duties are more expensive, and she really needs extra capital. Her current profit is not enough as she made big purchases for winter for her family. She purchased 4 tons of coal and food products.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes.

loans.name: Eli

texts.es:
Three months ago, Eli worked with a gentleman who made ice cream to sell, and this is how he learned the tricks of making good ice cream. This is where he realized that he could sell these products and make good profits. Little by little, with ups and downs, Eli made clients who came to him because of the delicious flavor that he gives to his ice cream.

However, in this season, his profits are scarce, his expenses are higher, and he is losing the money he had to buy merchandise. This is why he is requesting a loan of $300, which he will repay in 4 months. With this money, he will be able to buy merchandise to make his ice cream and not lose the clientele he has. In spite of the lower temperatures, many of his clients still look for his ice cream to eat. With your help, Eli will be able to succeed in this season and enter the warmer weather with more enthusiasm.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace más de trece años que Eli trabajaba con un señor que hacía nieves para vender fue como aprendió los trucos para elaborar unas buenas nieves. Fue ahí donde se dio cuenta que él podía vender estos productos y obtener mayores ganancias. Poco a poco y con altas y bajas Eli se ha ido haciendo de clientes que lo buscan por el rico sabor que les pone.

Sin embargo en esta temporada las ganancias son muy escasas, y los gastos se vuelven mayores y el dinero ahorrado para la mercancía se pierde. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y así con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para elaborar sus nieves y no perder la clientela con la que ya cuenta. Y es que a pesar de que las temperaturas bajan muchos de sus clientes siguen buscando nieves para comer. Con tu ayuda Eli podrá salir adelante en esta temporada y entrar con más ganas a los inicios de calor.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to make ice cream

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora T. F. owns a food sales business specializing in fried fish. The business is located at the municipal market of Chichigalpa. From a young age, she has had the experience needed for this venture, given that she previously helped her mother in the preparation of the food.

Sadly, her husband passed away, and for this reason she had to find a way to support her family, particularly her oldest daughter who is still a student. Mrs. T. starts selling on her way from her house to the market. Once there, she prepares the remainder of the food for the day and finishes selling it at the market.

Maria has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and she is very gratified by the loans that have been granted her previously. They have helped her to meet the needs of her business and meet customers' daily demands. She has a record of 22 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Auxiliadora T. F. posee un negocio de venta de comida siendo su especialidad el pescado frito.El negocio se ubica en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Ella desde muy joven tiene la experiencia en lo que respecta al negocio, ya que anteriormente ella le ayudaba a su mamá en la elaboración de los alimentos.

Lastimosamente su esposo fallece y por tal motivo busca la manera de cómo mantener su núcleo familiar y a su hija mayor que cursa la secundaria. Hoy en día la señora T. comienza vendiendo en las calles, haciendo recorrido desde su casa, pasando por las calles principales hasta el mercado municipal, que es donde termina la comida que hace para el día.

Doña Maria trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues se les han brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. El tiene un record de 22 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of meat and fish for food preparation.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu is 35 years old and married with 2 children.  She sells tie dyed materials, which she makes herself.  She started the business with only 4 yards of white cotton material.  With her previous loan, she increased her stock to 450 yards and could produce 130 suits.  Her income also increased.  Her plan is to sell her products wholesale, and therefore she would like a loan of $350 to increase her production

loans.use: Salamatu is experiencing great success with her business and needs additional capital to continue to attract new customers and meet the demand.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 30 years old and is a married woman with one child who is 3 years old. Eliza owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2005. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Doum

texts.en: Mrs. Doum S., 40, is married and has six children. She works with her husband as a broker, buying cows from breeders and selling them to butchers for a profit. This business generates around $7 a day in income. Mrs. Doum S. and her husband have applied for a loan to expand their business by buying more cows to sell. ( Mrs. Doum S.'s husband is pictured here with two oxen he would like to buy).

loans.use: To expand her  husband's business by buying more cows.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
I am dedicated to the sale of ‘Elotes Locos’ (corn with mayonnaise, salsa and cheese) and have had my business for four years. The business is located in my house so I can give it greater attention. At night I also sell tortillas with pork rind. My desire is to hire another person who can help me sell the corn in the fields to generate employment and also to profit from the sale of my corn.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith , Kiva volunteer.

Yo me dedico a la venta de Elotes Locos (elotes con mayonesa, salsa, y queso), llevo 4 años y medio de tenerlo, el negocio lo tengo en mi casa para poder darle una mejor atención, además por las noches vendo lo que es tortillas con chicharrón. Mi deseo es poder contratar a una persona para que me ayude a vender los elotes en el campo, y así poder generar un empleo y además tener una ganancia en la venta de mis elotes.

loans.use: Purchase of various articles to sell

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo I. is 28 years old. She is a widow and she has two children. Muhayo has received very little assistance in helping to raise her kids, so for the past 5 years she has been sewing dresses (e.g., the Tajikistan national dresses) for women because she feels that doing so is the only way to earn enough money to ensure a bright future for her kids. Muhayo works at home, where she takes orders and then fills the orders by sewing dresses to meet her customers' requests. Over these past five years, she has gained invaluable experience in the tailoring business. Muhayo specializes in sewing clothing for women, in both European styles and the national style of Tajikistan.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $600, which she will repay over 6 months, in order to purchase a new sewing machine to enable her to provide an even better tailoring service and to thereby make her business more profitable. Muhayo is counting on your help because, with your help, she will be able to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pork meat and other goods to keep operating her successful cafeteria.

loans.name: Naov

texts.en: Mrs. Naov R. is a fruit "middleman" in Phlov Trei Village in Kandal Province. She now buys mango fruit to resell. She is a 55-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a boat transporter who moves passengers across a river for an income. The younger one is attending the local school. Mrs. Naov R.'s family has only two businesses which can make a small income and savings. Mrs. Naov R. now wants to build a new house for her family; thus, she decided to ask for a loan in order to achieve this goal.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Adzélé

texts.fr: Née en 1969 à Notsè, Mme Adzélé W.  est mariée et a cinq  (05)  enfants à charge. Elle habite le quartier Togblé  Atsanvé. Elle est commerçante et vend des sacs de charbon de bois et des sacs de maïs. Elle sollicite ce crédit dans les soucis de développer son commerce et de subvenir aux besoins de sa grande famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Notsè, Mrs. Adzélé W. is married and has 5 children in her care. She lives in the Togblé Atsanvé neighborhood. She is a businesswoman who sells sacks of charcoal and sacks of maize. She is requesting this loan with a view to developing her business and supporting her big family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and re-sale of charcoal and maize

loans.name: Mohammad Smail

texts.en:
M. Smail lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he has a retail shop. When he started this business for the first time, he had a small business and he was very weak, but when he got an individual loan he really improved a lot in his business and still he is furthering his business, attracting some good numbers of customers, making a good income for his family, and repaying the loan without any difficulty and on time.

Therefore he has requested his second-cycle loan to enlarge his shop and continue his business with even more success. He is sure that he can be a good business dealer in the future.

He is happy with this loan. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFSG and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to be strong in their businesses. Finally, he wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia tiene 51 años, es divorciada, vive con sus hijos Marisol de 16, Cristian de 13 y Carla de 12. Pese a sus limitaciones, ya que no sabe leer, ni escribir, se ha desenvuelto muy bien en el negocio de elaboración de bolsos con mantas tejidas de la zona, de esto ya 30 años. Los pedidos que recibe Dionisia son para exportarlos al extranjero, es por eso que se le hace estresante cumplir con las cantidades que le solicitan, pero los 30 años de experiencia que posee hacen que siempre cumpla con todo, siendo su trabajo muy rentable. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que gentilmente Dionisia solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de mantas, cierres, hebillas, hilos, etc.  para elaborar sus bolsos y cubrir los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 51 years old, she is divorced and she lives with her children, Marisol who is 16, Cristian who is 13, and Carla who is 12. Despite her limitations, not being able to read or write, she has done very well in the business making traditional bags native to the region, a business she has been running for the past 30 years. The orders received by Dionisia are for international export. It is stressing for her to meet the quantities that are required from her, but given her 30 years' experience she knows how to always meet the requirements, making this very profitable work. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the funds that Dionisia requests very gratefuly, she will purchase greater quantities of cloth, zippers, buckles, threads, etc. to make her bags and to cover the orders that her clients place.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her work, such as cloth, and threads etc.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda A. is 27 years old. She is married with two children. Currently one of her kids is in school and the other has not yet started school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, and other sundries in the local market. She also sells charcoal to provide her with extra income to support her kids in school. She wants to use the loan to expand her business by buying bulk supplies of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. Patricia hopes the expanded business will increase her income and enable her to provide a quality education for her children. She belongs to the community group called Ephesians Trust Group. The group members guarantee each others loans through a repayment pledge to assist one another in loan repayment. She does not sell on group meeting days.  Her picture was taken at a group meeting with her youngest child.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace G. is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She sells goat meat at the Oliha market. The demand for her goat meat is very high.  She requests a loan in the amount of N100, 000 to purchase more goat meat to sell. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more goat meat to sell

loans.name: Dominico's Group

texts.en:
Dominico M. is a very hard-working and down-to-earth man with various businesses to run. He is a farmer with various crops such sweet potatoes, cassava and yams growing both for sale and for home consumption. He has commercial rental houses from which he earns a monthly income, and he also makes bark cloth for sale. In fact he is well known through out Mpigi and the surrounding areas for making quality products and this has won him many customers.

Dominico now has other construction works going on building rental houses and he needs a loan to be able to complete this construction by buying cement, iron bars, wiring, and paying off his workers and in the end, this will earn him more by renting out these premises.

loans.use: buying construction materials such as cement, bricks, iron bars and timber to finish his rental houses

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 31-years old and married with three children. Victoria sells clothes, and she wants to expand her business by also selling of palm oil in addition to her clothes business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase the palm oil needed for selling. This will increase her earnings and improve her family's living conditions. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase palm oil to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia G. J. es socia del Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”, en el barrio Santa Barbara, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos y posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace año y medio, ella posee un negocio de venta de ropas en las ferias locales de Yunguyo, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de mercaderías (casacas y cubrecamas) para su negocio. 
Ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, dicho préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mercadería y complementar su negocio (chompas, polleras, cubrecamas, etc.) todo al por mayor (por docenas), ella piensa adquirir un auto en el futuro para poder trasladar su mercadería, asimismo desea que sus hijos sean profesionales con el apoyo que les brinda.
texts.en:
Lidia G. J. is a member of Unión 28 de Julio Communal Banc, in the neighborhood Santa Barbara, district Yunguyo, province Yunguyo, departament Puno; she is 31 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. She completed primary school. Lidia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year and half. She has her own business selling cloths at the local markets throughout the Yunguyo area. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00, which she used to purchase merchandise (jackets and bead-spreads) for her business. She would like another loan, this time for S/. 1200.00, which she will repay in 3 monthly installments. The loan will help her buy merchandise to stock her business and add products (sweaters, skirts, bead-spreads, etc.) to sell whole sale (in groups of twelve). Lidia hopes to one day have car, for transporting her merchandise. She also dreams that her children, with her help, will have professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise (sweaters, skirts, bead-spreads, etc.) to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita M. is a 43 year-old mother of three who lives in Sebaste, Antique Province, at the northern end of the island of Panay.   Her husband is a farmer.   Anita applied for this loan to buy items for resale at her sari sari shop.  "Sari sari" is Tagalog for "various kinds" and she sells an array of basic foodstuffs, beverages and everyday commodities.  Sari sari shops fill an important economic and social niche in Filipino life, especially in rural areas.   Anita hopes to earn enough income from her shop to support her children's education.

loans.use: Buy inventory for a small general store.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has three daughters and a son who are all currently in the basic school. She lives with her family at Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Regina’s husband is food crop farmer. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for ten years now. She sells items such as gari, rice, groundnuts, tins of tomato, milk, sugar etc. She procures her goods from wholesalers in the big towns around such as Nkawkaw.

She seeks a loan to expand the size of her shop and also buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her save more to support her family, especially her children’s educations. She belongs to a trust bank group called Heaven. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: El señor Paulino Leytón P. , tiene la edad de 41 años , habita en el barrio , Piedra quemada municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar ,ellos tienen a su cargo dos hijos , los cuales estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es poder darle estudio para que se preparen sus hijos y comprar un terreno propio , don Paulino desde hace veinte años trabaja como agricultor , el mayor problema es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio los trabajos agrícolas con sus propios esfuerzos , con el financiamiento va a comprar  fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para aplicarse a su cultivo y poder tener una producción. Con esto espera poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Paulino Leytón P. is 41 years old. He lives in the Piedra Municipio neighborhood in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who helps him with household expenses. They have two children who are currently students. His desires for his family are to send his children to school, and to buy land. Paulino has worked as a farmer for twenty years. His biggest problem is lack of financing. He started his agricultural work with his own efforts. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and the necessary equipment to work on his land and to have a good harvest. With this, he hopes to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy equipment and fertilizers to increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy five 50-kg sacks of corn, two 50-liter drums of palm oil, and three 25-liter drums of peanut oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase commodities in bulk for her store.

loans.name: Beatrice Achieng

texts.en:
Beatrice has been operating a salon along Nairobi Road in Kisumu, Kenya for about 10 years. She specializes in styling hair, filing and painting nails, and selling weaves for her customers. With three children—one in college, one in secondary school, and one at home—she struggles to cover expenses. However, she hopes that with the proceeds from her loan, she can purchase a new hair dryer. This will allow her to have two dryers in her salon, which would let her serve multiple customers simultaneously.

Beatrice says that doing the business is easy and that she feels very competent to offer a quality service—it’s finding the capital that is difficult.

loans.use: A New Hair Dryer

loans.name: Rasoolan Abdul Khaliq Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan baji is married to A. K., and they have lived in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Her husband is a painter by profession and paints people’s houses. He also sells paint boxes to shops. He has eight years of experience in this business. Rasoolan baji is applying for a loan to buy paint boxes and tools for her husband so that he is able to grow his business. Rasoolan baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality.

Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.
Mahmood begum baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell.
Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.
Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Rasoolan baji is seated on a chair in this photo.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes and tools

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mercedes tiene la edad 43 años, reside en el barrio el Pilar en la capital de Managua, casada y  con un hijo de 18 años que estudia, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace doce años administra, su esposo trabaja como contador ya que el con sus ahorro le puso la venta. Con esta solicitud quiere comprar mercadería variada para incrementar las ventas con la variedad de productos, como: granos básicos, carnes y frutas. Sus planes es poder obtener más clientela y obtener mejores resultados económicos
texts.en:
Doña Mercedes is 43 years old. She lives in the town of El Pilar, in the capital of Managua. She is married and has an eighteen year old son who is a student. Her business is a convenience store, which she has managed for twelve years. Her husband, who is an accountant, helped her start the business with his savings. With this request, she wants to purchase an assortment of products, such as staple grains, meats and fruits, in order to increase sales. Her goal is to increase her customer base and improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple grains, meats and fruits

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn J. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Merlyn is married and has nine adult children. Merlyn operates a business selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling kitchen supplies and other products, such as bags and slippers, to tourists and local community members. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for more than10 years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Juhudi borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya,. She is 39  years old, she  is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 16, 13, and 10 years old.

Joyce has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 7 years. She works 10 hours a day and she ears a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings. 

This is Joyce`s  first loan from BRAC_Tanzanian, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,  Joyce hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Annah is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 100,000 Tsh in order to expand her food business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort G. is married and has three children. She has no educational background.  Comfort sells various kinds of soaps such as bar soap, sunlight, tooth brush and liquid soap near Nyankumasi, which she has been doing since 2004. Her husband is a station master.  Comfort uses her income to support the husband in the payment of utility bills.  Comfort will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to add her capital to increase her business.

loans.use: Comfort will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hauyacan Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Hauyacan” esta representado por la señora Evelyn  y conformado por 12 miembros muy unido y organizado en sus reuniones responsables en el horario y en sus cuotas. La presidenta tiene como actividad venta D. cotillo y venta D. tortas, lo realiza en su domicilio y los cotillones entrega pedidos es madre D. 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio, la señora Jacinta Q. tesorera del banco comunal tiene 7 hijos que estudian en el colegio, ella tiene como actividad la venta D. pan en su domicilio y el resto D. los miembros del grupo tienen actividades como la atención en puntos D. llamaD., venta D. comiD., atención en bazar, servicio D. limpieza y otras actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos. La competencia hoy en día se ve más en otros años pero lo importante es que ellas tiene clientes fijos y ellas siempre cumplen al pedido D. sus clientes, además tratan D. vender su producto a un menor precio y minimizan sus costos y  generar una ganancia razonable para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del crédito es para comprar materiales para realizar su cotillón, compra D. harina y otros insumos para la elaboración D. sus productos y compra D. material para agrandar sus negocios como comprar tarjetas D. crédito al por mayor. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia los socios ya tienen experiencia en grupos comunales gracias a créditos similares en otras instituciones por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo y saben como administrar bien los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The Hauyacan Communal Bank is represented by Evelyn and is comprised of twelve members. They are very united and organized in their meetings. They are responsible about the schedule and in their payments. The president sells decorations and cakes in her home. She delivers the ordered decorations. She has two children who go to school. Jacinta is the treasurer of the Communal Bank. She has seven children who go to school. She sells bread in her home. The rest of the members have activities like call centers, food sales, working in a bazaar, cleaning services, and other commercial activities selling products. There is more competition these days, but the important thing is that they have regular customers, and they always fill their customers’ orders. Also, they try to sell their products at a lower price and minimize their costs to generate reasonable earnings to support their families. The loan is to buy materials to make decorations, to buy flour and other supplies to make their products, and to buy materials like wholesale credit cards to expand their businesses. As far as their credit experience goes, the members have experience in communal groups thanks to similar loans in other institutions. They know the type of work and how to do a good job of administering the given funds.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette L. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 46 years old and married and has three adult children. To make a living, Bernadette owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Bernadette has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.

In 2004, Bernadette joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bernadette has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Bernadette is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her twelfth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 61 years old and a resident of Gampis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and blessed with five children. Her husband has no income because he has been disabled since they were married. Their children are all in school and the school miscellaneous expenditures and the school tuition fees have been increased.

Remedios finds ways on her own to support her husband and her family. She owns a small carinderia (restaurant) that she started with a small amount of capital. She has been an active member of Paglaum since October 2009 and is thankful that Paglaum came to their place because she believes that it can help to put up additional capital for her business, while she also enjoys the programs and services it offers.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her carinderia

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta M. has run a sari-sari store (community-based store) for three years now where she earns a monthly income of Php2,000 which is not enough to sustain the needs of her family and the education of her niece. She is having a difficult time because the income of her parents as a farmer is being used as rolling capital for their farming needs since the farm inputs today are very expensive. Jacinta wants to improve her business and income and so she is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from KIVA lenders in order to increase the amount of merchandise she carries. She hopes that her loan request will be granted soon.

At the age of 49, Jacinta is still single and enjoys her business with the support of her parents. She is living with her parents in Barangay of Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Bamu Group 1, Jinja

texts.en: N. Asha is 35 years old and married with six children aged 5 to 18 years old. She is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. Asha is a friendly lady with a business selling produce. She started as a trader in the village 20 years ago and now works from Amber Court Market with her own stall. She is able to make 50,000/= profit per week. Asha ensures that she has quality produce for sale, hence attracting more customers. She hopes to expand her business further as well as educate her children to the highest levels possible. Asha needs to buy more produce for resale to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy more produce like matooke, sweet potatoes, cassava, etc for resale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is 65 years old. She is widowed and has eight children, some are in school.  Aba lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana.  She works hard to provide for the family and is a trader of game meat.  Aba buys freshly hunted game from local hunters, smokes the meat and supplies food vendors in her community. Aba has been in business for over twenty years and wants to increase her stock and profits.  She wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: Buy game meat.

loans.name: Estela Maras

texts.es:
Estela pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA D. RACCHI” D. la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 35 años, es madre soltera    y tiene un hijo llamado José Antonio D.  8 años D. edad. Ellos viven en la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco.
  
Estela se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno para su  menor hijo y después tiene que atender su restaurante “MARACINITA”. Estela nos cuenta que trabaja desD. las 5 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. 
Susana es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para comprar más  insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azucar, fideos vegetales y carne. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Estela is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Asunta D. Racchi”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is 35 years old and a single mother with an eight year old son named José Antonio. They live in the Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

Estela wakes up early to perform her household duties, such as preparing breakfast for her son. Afterwards, she manages her restaurant called “Maracinita”. Estela tells us that she works from 5am until 8pm. This working mother and entrepreneur is requesting a loan to purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, and meat. She has been in business for several years and has done very well because of her hard work.

Estela is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables, and meat

loans.name: Bulganbat

texts.en:
Bulganbat is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in a house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest son is in the army, her second son is a driver who conducts a taxi service, while her youngest studies at university in Korea.

Bulganbat operates a vegetable-trading business with the help of her husband. Bulganbat is responsible for selling the vegetables and her husband is responsible for delivery. They started their business in 1993 and became quite popular amongst their customers because of the wide product selection. They have gained much experience and a good reputation.

To supplement their earnings Bulganbat’s husband drives his car during the night, transporting people. He has also recently been hired as a welder at a private company with a monthly salary of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). For the future, they are planning to continue their business.

Bulganbat is a person who has a great passion to achieve her goals. She says, "I am working hard to open my own shop in the future." She is requesting a 2,100,000 tugrug loan to purchase more carrots, potatoes, cabbages, onions, etc.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en: Henrietta S. D. sells baked bread and cakes in Abura near Cape Coast. S. D. has received a senior high education. She is married and has three children. S. D. has been selling bread for some time now. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and other family responsibilities. Her loan will be used to buy flour, margarine and other ingredients for baking. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine and other ingredients for baking

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hija de dos años de edad en casa de su suegro, ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, un distrito agrícola ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace seis meses, empezó en el negocio animada por una amigas que le comentaron lo rentable de vender cosméticos por catálogo y durante este tiempo ha estado trabajando duro y ya es conocida en la zona. Maria Elena nos comenta que durante los primeros meses tenia que caminar en busca de clientes, ahora lo clientes son los que la van a buscar. 

Aun asi ella no descansa y se ha propuesto ampliar su negocio. Su mayor motivación es la pequeña hija que tiene y el apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia. Su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción civil y con los ingresos que ambos perciben solventan los gastos familiares y ahorran para poder construir su casa.

María Elena desea adquirir más productos cosméticos para contar con un stock permanente, de manera que sus clientes no esperen el fin de mes (fecha cuando llega el pedido que hacen) para tener los productos que necesitan. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el logro de su objetivo.

Maria Elena es una mujer trabajadora y alegre. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y tener un puesto en el mercado de Cayaltí donde pueda vender sus productos a mas personas.
texts.en:
María Elena, 27, lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter in her father-in-law’s house, which is located in Cayaltí district, an agricultural area an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For the last six months she has sold cosmetics. She started the business encouraged by some friends that told her how profitable selling cosmetics by catalogue could be. During this time, she has been working hard and she is now well-known in the area. María Elena tells us that during the first few months she had to go out searching for potential customers; now it’s the customers that come to look for her. Even so, she does not rest and aims to expand her business. Her greatest motivation is her little daughter and the need to help support her family. Her husband works as a laborer in construction and with both their incomes they are able to meet household expenses and save some to build their house. María Elena wants to get more cosmetics so that she can have permanent stock available and her customers don’t have to wait until the end of the month, which is when her orders are filled, to get the items they need. For this reason, she is calling upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to ask for a 1000 new sol loan which she will invest to reach her goal. María Elena is a hard-working, cheerful woman. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman and to have a stall in Cayaltí’s market where she can sell her products to more people.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Cesar Edward

texts.es:
Cesar, tiene 18 años, es soltero y actualmente esta estudiando la carrera profesional de turismo en el instituto privado “ESITUR” y esta cursando el tercer semestre. Cesar en sus hora libres ayuda a vender artesanía en el stand de sus papas. Ya son doce años que ayuda a sus papas con la venta. Cesar va abrir un taller de confección de artesanía de tipo platería y él va proveedor de productos a sus papas. Cesar nos cuenta que el turismo ha bajado y las ventas también  debido a las precipitaciones fluviales que cayeron en la ciudad, haciendo que muchos turistas cancelen sus viajes. Cesar usará el crédito para comprar herramientas de trabajo como incrustadora, soldadora y materiales como plata. El sueño de Cesar es terminar su carrera profesional y comprar un automóvil que servirá para uso personal y para llevar productos a las ciudades de Puno y Urubamba. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
18 year-old Cesar is single and currently studying tourism at a private institute called Esitur. He is in his third term. In his free time Cesar helps his parents sell crafts at their stall, a job he’s been doing for the last twelve years. Cesar is going to start a workshop making silverware and then give these crafts to his parents to sell. He says that tourism and sales are not doing very well because of the heavy rains that fell on the city, forcing many tourists to cancel their bookings. Cesar will use the loan to buy silversmithing tools such as a soldering iron, and materials like silver. His greatest wish is complete his professional training and buy a car both for personal use and to transport products to the towns of Puno and Urubamba. He is grateful for this opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to repay it according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma P. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, she has a business buying and selling coconuts and green bananas. She has had her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used as working capital. Emma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy more coconuts and bananas for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 27-year-old single man. He manufactures and sells soaps and detergents in Nairobi to earn a living.  He has been in the business for three years and has one employee. He saves his money with his group in Faulu Kenya called `Mla jasho’ which guarantees loans to its members.  He appreciates Faulu Kenya for the training they offered him, together with his group members, because he learnt to keep business records. 

George hopes to grow his business to a wholesale one and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock of raw materials for manufacture of soaps and detergents for sale. He describes himself as hard-working and loyal.

loans.use: To add stock of raw materials for manufacture of soaps and detergents for sale

loans.name: Adiaratou

texts.fr:
Madame Adiaratou  Koné a 41 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vit  avec son mari,  sa coépouse et  leurs  enfants, dans une famille polygame, dans le quartier Darsalam II de la préfecture de Koutiala.  
Madame Adiaratou n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, raison pour laquelle elle s’est très vite intéressée au commerce depuis son enfance auprès de sa mère. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus, elle finit par opter pour  l’activité d’achat et de vente d’habits wax depuis  plus de vingt ans. Sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit plusieurs commandes dans le mois. 
Pour l’agrandissement de son activité et la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, elle n’a pas pris du temps à rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2 ans.  Madame Adiaratou, après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) auprès de Soro Yiriwaso tous correctement  remboursés, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel. 
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants du grand marché de Bamako (capitale du Mali) et souvent à Koutiala et compte acheter, 10 pièces de tissus wax. 
Elle effectue sa  vente dans la ville de Koutiala et  dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants à crédit et au comptant. 
Elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel de 75.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt  de Soro Yiriwaso et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.  
Madame Adiaratou ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de vente d’habits et divers dans le marché de Koutiala.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adiaratou Koné is 41 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She lives with her husband, her husband’s second wife and their children, as a polygamous family, in the Darsalam II district in the Koutiala prefecture. Mrs. Adiaratou did not have an opportunity to go to school, and this is why she started learning a business from her mother at an early age. After trying several commercial activities, she has settled on purchasing and reselling “wax” clothing [made of traditional colorful fabrics], which she has been practicing for more than 20 years now. Her business is popular, and she receives many orders each month. In order to grow her business and better satisfy customer demand, she wasted no time in joining the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. She has been a member for two years and had four solidarity (group) loans, all of which were duly repaid. She is now on her first individual loan. She purchases her stock from the vendors at the big market of Bamako (the capital of Mali) and often in Koutiala; she plans to purchase ten sets of “wax” fabric. She sells her wares in the town of Koutiala as well as at the weekly markets in neighboring towns, on credit or for cash. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 75,000 West African Francs, which she intends to use to repay her loan interest to Soro Yiriwaso and contribute to the everyday family expenses. Her goal is to open a shop selling clothing and miscellaneous items at the Koutiala market.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing of traditional fabrics [for resale]

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose B. is from the village of Magalalag, Enrile, Cagayan. He is 47 years old and is single. Jose owns and operates a business providing recycling services, primarily hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities.
