He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Jose is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This loan will be his sixth from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia A., 65, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She makes sure that she earns well so her brood of five can have a better life.  She has been managing her own dried fish business for quite some time now.

Bonifacia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her dried fish business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities and kinds of dried fish and other dried seafood that she will be selling.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow, enough for her to be self-sufficient, self-sustaining and to be able to finally stop borrowing money.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities and kinds of dried fish

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
From the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province, Miriam B. is 41 years old, married, and has one school-aged child . To make a living, Miriam owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Miriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to invest in expanding the business, she is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Miriam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. Based in Cagayan de Oro City, it is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita T. is from the village of Bularan, Miputak. She is 54 years old. Rita is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Rita raises pigs to sell. Rita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Rita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Rita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her hog-raising business. This will be Rita's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog-raising business

loans.name: Maria  Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa Y. tiene 36 años vive con su cónyuge en el municipio de Malambo en el departamento del Atlántico y con sus 4 hijos en las edades de 8 a 16 años de edad. Desde allí se dedica a la venta de pescado y a la comercialización de mercancía variada, que son sus dos actividades y principales generadoras de ingresos. 
María Teresa es una mujer muy organizada, comenzó su actividad  de vender pescado, hace 16 años junto a su cónyuge, ella salía a vender en la calle y a los empleados de un parque industrial llamado PINZA, ubicado en esta población; en ese momento  transportaba el pescado en cajas de icopor, sus principales clientes eran sus vecinos, familiares y amigos, y utilizaba el enfriador de su suegra; pero gradualmente la familia fue creciendo y llenándose de otras necesidades. Así fuè como cuando le hablaron de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, buscó el beneficio del crédito de esta organización el año 2004 por un valor de $900.000 COP, allí logró darle un impulso a su actividad y luego mediante otro crédito recibió $1,300.000 COP y así mismo el tercero por valor de  $1.500.000. COP, y finalmente otro por valor de $1.500.000 COP; todos los invirtió con disciplina en su negocio, logrando ahorrar de sus utilidades y comprar un lote y sobre esta base solicitó un nuevo crédito simultaneo de mejoramiento de vivienda, con lo que construyó su casa y el que ya canceló totalmente.
Este es su sexto crédito y con él comprará un enfriador para guardar sus pescados y no pasar trabajo con su refrigeración y además para conservarlos; con el resto de dinero comprará mercancía que tiene encargada  y una canoa porque María Teresa pertenece a una familia de pescadores, su cónyuge participa en la pre cooperativa  de pescadores Nuevo Amanecer y pesca en la laguna que está ubicada al lado de las empresas de Malambo. Ellos tenían una canoa que se rompió y necesitan otra, porque en la actualidad compran el pescado a otros pescadores y les sale a un mayor precio.
Desde que participa en los programas de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha podido tener un capital para seguir negociando, ha mejorado sus condiciones habitacionales y sueña con terminar de hacer todas las adecuaciones que requiere una saludable convivencia familiar, para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. Su mayor desafío es el invierno, que no la deja salir  por efecto de los arroyos y se le disminuyen las ventas, por eso su negocio simultáneo es la venta de mercancía variada porque encontró su nicho de mercado en los mismos clientes que le compran pescado.
texts.en:
María Teresa Y. is 36 years old and lives with her husband in the town of Malambo in the Department of Atlántico. They have four children between the ages of 8 and 16. María has two businesses, one selling fish and the other selling general merchandise. Both of these activities are her main sources of income.

María Teresa is a very organized woman. She began selling fish with her husband when she was 16 years old. María worked as a street merchant, selling to employees who worked at an industrial park called PINZA that was located in her town. At the time, she transported the fish in polystyrene coolers. Her main customers were neighbors, relatives, and friends. She even resorted to borrowing her mother-in-law’s refrigerator. As her family slowly grew, so did the number of other needs that she had to fulfill. It was around that time that she talked with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo about applying for a loan. In 2004, she received a loan from the organization in the amount of 900,000 COP which she used to boost her business. Later she received another loan for 1,300,000 COP, and then a third loan for 1,500,000 COP, and finally an additional loan that was also worth 1,500,000 COP. All of the funds were invested into her business with great discipline. Using the earning she had saved, she was able to buy a plot of land and became eligible to apply for a new loan which she used to build her house. Her housing loan has since been repaid completely.

This is her sixth loan. She will buy a refrigerator where she can store her fish when she is not working. With the rest of the money, she will pay for merchandise that she has ordered and purchase a canoe since she belongs to a family of fishermen. Her husband is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer fishing cooperative and fishes in the lagoon in Malambo, which is near where many businesses are located. They have a canoe that is in disrepair, so they need another one. At the moment, María buys her fish from other fishermen and then sells it at a higher price.

Since participating in the programs offered by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, María has been able to build up enough capital to continue her business and make improvements to her living conditions. She dreams of finishing all of the adjustments she has to make for her family to live a healthy life and for her children to have a secure future. Her greatest challenge occurs in winter when her fish sales decline because she does not go out to sell. With her other business, she is able to sell different merchandise to the same customers who buy fish from her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator for storing fish, a fishing canoe for her husband, and merchandise for her second business

loans.name: Qabil

texts.en: Qabil A. is 45 years old. He has two years of experience in the butcher business. His wife is a housekeeper, and Qabil is the sole breadwinner in his family. Due to this way of life, this father of three children works hard every day to support his family with the best quality of life he can afford. His butcher shop supplies large amounts of meat to the people who reside in the area. Qabil buys cattle at the market and sells fresh meat daily to his customers. Due to high demand, this man seeks a loan of 500 Azerbaijani manat (AZN) to invest in more cattle so he can have enough meat to meet his customers’ demand.

loans.use: buying more cattle to butcher

loans.name: Dina Emerita

texts.es:
Dina tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Cayaltí, una zona agrícola D. regular movimiento comercial, se encuentra situada a mas D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la  venta D. productos lacteos como queso, quesillo, manjar blanco, entre otros. Los adquiere en la ciudad D. Cajamarca, lleva ya mas D. 2 años en esta actividad y trabaja en base a pedidos, sus principales clientes se encuentran en Cayalti. Los ingresos que percibe D. este negocio los utiliza en ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Ella se esfuerza mucho y siempre trata D. conseguir nuevos clientes.

Dina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas productos D. modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y también sus ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles. Con los cuales espera dar a su negocio el impulso que necesita para crecer.

Su mas granD. anhelo es crecer lo suficiente como para poder instalar una bodega en su vivienda. Ella es una mujer tranquila, responsable y entregada a su familia. En la imagen aparece junto a su nieto.
texts.en:
Dina is 46 years old and married. She has 1 child and lives with her family in the Cayaltí district, an agricultural zone with a steady flow of traD.. It is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Dina works selling products such as cheese, farmer's cheese, and manjar blanco [thickened sweetened condensed milk], among others. She buys them in the city of Cajamarca. She has done this work for more than 2 years, and she sells in response to customer orders. Her main customers are located in Cayalti. She uses the income she receives from this business to help her husband with the family's expenses. She works very hard and is always trying to obtain new customers. Dina wants to expand her business by purchasing more products, so that she can increase her sales and also her earnings. To achieve her objective, she has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1000 Peruvian new soles. With these funds, she hopes to give her business the impetus it needs in order to grow. Her greatest desire is to expand enough so that she can set up a shop in her home. She is a calm, responsible woman who is very dedicated to her family. In the photo, she appears together with her grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to expand her business of selling in response to orders

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta S. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 60 years old and is married with one adult child. Vicenta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily meals and boost food (staples like bread, etc.) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Vicenta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and upgrade her poultry farm.

loans.name: Ediomar

texts.en:
Ediomar A. M. is 26 years old. He lives with his wife and children in their own home in La Viña near the city of Cayaltí. This is a primarily rural area characterized by farms and animal raising.

Ediomar has been raising animals for over ten years. He is very experienced in the care and raising of various varieties of animals. He is well respected in the area for the quality of the meat he sells, his hard work and the support he provides for his neighbors.

Ediomar plans to use the loan to purchase additional animals in order to expand his herd and also to purchase a balanced feed. He hopes to be able to raise and sell a few of his animals during the holiday season when prices are higher. He hopes to be able to send his children to university one day and make improvements to his home.

The client has worked with our institution previously. He has a good record of repayment and presents sufficient income to manage this new loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals to expand his herd and also to purchase a balanced feed

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin S. is a 44-year-old married woman who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh. She is a housewife, and she always works many duties in her house such as cleaning house, cooking, and take care her children also. Chin S. has a life partner in her husband (pictured), who works as a army. This couple is blessed with three children, two of whom are enrolled school, while the other one married and employed in private company as internal staff. Besides of this, Chin S. also feeds a few pigs in a cage behind her house for extra profit in order to support her family. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Chin S. and her family, Chin S. has requested a loan in order to purchase pigs to rise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest cost.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to rise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest cost.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. lives in the Lungujja Kitunzi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters).  Eva has a business selling second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  

Eva sells her products at the retail market.  Eva has requested a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes.   She also generates additional income through tailoring.  The main business challenges for Eva include the transport and ever increasing prices of clothes.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second hand clothes.  Eva lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria M., from Talibon Bohol, has a food store that she has been running for 10 years already. Aside from the usual food items that she sells, like "puto" and "bibingka" (types of rice cakes), she believes that funding from CEVI would allow her to sell more products and expand her business. This would make her business more competitive and profitable.

Apolinaria has four children. The additional income would help her provide for the family's daily needs and enable her to send her children to school.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ibrahim M.  est l’un des clients de Soro Yiriwaso, qui  est marié et père de 4 enfants. Ibrahim a 35 ans et vit à Sienso, un des quartiers périphériques de San (région de Ségou)
L’activité principale de Monsieur Ibrahim est l’achat et la vente des téléphones portables ainsi que des cartes de recharges, des batteries pour téléphones, des façades de téléphones et autres accessoires pour téléphones. Il est très sollicité dans son activité.
Dans le souci de satisfaire ses clients qui deviennent de plus en plus nombreux  Ibrahim intègre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son deuxième cycle de prêt individuel  et le premier a été correctement remboursé. 
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako tous les mois et compte acheter avec ce nouveau prêt, 200 portables  de toutes séries confondues, 100 batteries et plusieurs  paquets d’accessoires.  Monsieur Ibrahim espère réaliser par mois  50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des échéances, subvenir au besoin de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahim M. is a client of Soro Yiriwaso, married and the father of four. Ibrahim is 35 years old and lives in Sienso, a peripheral district of San (Ségou Region). His main line of business is purchase and resale of mobile phone as well as phone recharge cards, batteries, covers, and other mobile accessories.  His business is very much in demand. In order to better meet the needs of his clients, whose numbers keep growing, Ibrahim joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and is now on his second individual loan, having duly repaid his first loan.

Ibrahim stocks up in Bamako once a month and plans to use this new loan to purchase 200 mobile phones of all kinds of different brands and models, 100 batteries and several packs of accessories. He hopes to earn 50,000 West African francs per month, which will be used to repay his loan and provide for his family’s needs, with the rest reinvested in his business

loans.use: Purchasing mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Twegatte Association-Jinja Group

texts.en: The spokesman for this group, 31 year old Paul I., has a story similar to many of the members of the Twegatte Association-Jinja group. Paul has had his farming business for three years in Jinja. He mostly sells crops, such as maize and beans, which he harvests from his gardens. Paul says he started out as a small scale farmer and later worked in a motorcycle transportation business, commonly referred to in Uganda as Boda Boda. His modest success in business he says all boils down to one thing - hard work. Paul's weekly business profits add up to 70,000 shillings. He is happily married with three kids. Paul will use this loan to procure more bags of the aforementioned crops. He says he is also going to use some of the proceeds to improve his farming gardens and to buy goats.

loans.use: The procurement of more maize and beans for resell, manure for his gardens and goats.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia M. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Cecilia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Cecilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to make further repairs to a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Cecilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair transport vehicle

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina tiene 48 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo y de sus dos hijos, quienes aún estudian. Desde hace muchos años. Alejandrina se dedica a la venta da chicharrones, sándwich y caldo de gallina en épocas de invierno. Pero,  para la temporada de verano, vende jugos y refrescos de fruta,  acompañado de chicharrones, platillo que gustan mucho a sus clientes, en su mayoría son policías, ya que trabaja cerca de una comisaría. Este negocio lo realiza en la puerta de su casa, durante las mañanas, solo así se genera buenas utilidades con los que puede educar a sus hijos. Se siente muy contenta por el dinamismo de su negocio, aunque a veces termina muy agotada  para el medio día. Esta emprendedora mujer desea en adelante instalar un local, para poder intensificarse en el negocio de la venta de jugos, ya que en su zona carecen de este  negocio. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues desea tener mejoras para su negocio. En su banco comunal, es una socia muy responsable y preocupada por el bienestar de su grupo. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará frutas frescas  y renovar sus accesorios de cocina, para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 48 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband and her two children who are still studying.  For a long time, Alejandrina has been selling 'chicharrones' (fried pork rinds), sandwiches and chicken soup during the winter season.  During the summer season, she sells juice and fruit drinks together with 'chicharrones', a dish that is very popular with her customers who are mainly policemen who work in a nearby police station.  Alejandrina carries out her business in the doorway of her home every morning.  She makes good profits which she uses to educate her children.

Alejandrina feels very happy with how dynamic her business is although sometimes she is exhausted by midday.  This enterprising woman would like, in the future, to set up business premises so that she can strengthen her juice sales business as there is a lack of this type of business in her area.

This is Alejandrina's 11th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time since she would like to keep improving her business.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank who is always concerned for the group's well-being.  She will use this loan to buy fresh fruit and to renew her cooking utensils in order to provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruit and to renew her cooking utensils

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio G., de 41 años de edad, natural del distrito de Anco,  convive con Nancy Berrocal de 26 años y  fruto de ese gran amor tienen 02 hijos;  Annie de 04 años y Rebeca de 01 año de edad,  juntos viven en su casa propia en la comunidad de Santa Rosa  departamento de Ayacucho. Aurelio, es un hombre trabajador que lucha por la prosperidad de su familia. Su Trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno, en donde cultiva, hojas de coca, cacao y café. Ha trabajando durante 13 años y según afirma que le aún le gusta esta actividad, además que lo hace de manera independiente y durante el tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros que contrata para extraer el cacao y las hojas de coca, productos comprados por las empresas acopiadoras, dándole muy buen rentabilidad. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde la cosecha hasta el punto de secado. En adelante, espera juntar más dinero, para comprar nuevas tierras y sembrar nuevas plantas como plátano y piña. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Con los dos  mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y  fertilizantes para mejorar su parcela y así obtener mejores cosechas mas adelante.
texts.en: Aurelio G., 41, is a native of the Anco district.  He lives with Nancy Berrocal, 26, and from this relationship has 2 children: Annie, 4, and Rebeca,1. They all live together in their own home in the community of Santa Rosa in the department of Ayacucho.  Aurelio is a hardworking man who strives to provide his family with prosperity.  He is a farmer who has 4 hectares of land where he cultivates coca leaves, cocoa and coffee.  He has worked for 13 years, and states that he still enjoys this work, since he can work independently.  During the harvest season he hires workers to help him harvest the cocoa and coca leaves, products that are purchased by the wholesale companies that give him good profits.  What he considers to be most difficult is to move the products from the harvest to the drying area.  In the future, he hopes to gather together more money to buy new lands and to cultivate new crops such as bananas and pineapples.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he feels that this support will help him a lot to make progress with his business.  With the 2,000 Peruvian soles requested, he will buy cocoa seeds and fertilizers to improve his land and in this way obtain better harvests in the future.

loans.use: to buy cocoa seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ayélé Mawuéna

texts.fr: Dame  Ayélé est  mariée et  a 41 ans.  Elle a à charge  un enfant.  Elle fait la  vente   de  sacs dame   à Atikoumé. Elle  s’approvisionne au grand  marché de  Lomé  et compte dans cette  activité 6 ans d’expérience.  Elle  sollicite  de WAGES  un prêt  pour  acheter  20  sacs dame. Elle  est  née  à  Lomé  et habite  quartier  Agbalépédo.
texts.en: Ayele is married and she is 41 years old. She has one child in her care. She sells ladies’ hand bags at Atikoume. She makes her purchases in the large market in Lome and she has 6 years’ experience in the business. She requests a loan from Wages (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase 20 ladies’ purses. She was born in Lome and she lives in the Agbalepedo quarter.

loans.use: To purchase ladies' handbags.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy traditional clothing and clay griddles for making tortillas.

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 4 Group

texts.en:
Alejandrina is the coordinator of her group Amor y Paz 4 (love and peace). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to travel to other cities.

Alejandrina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and increased her business. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods for daily meals. She operates a Colmado (a small food store). She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to save because she wants to build a house. She is dreaming of having her own safe structure and living tranquilly with her family. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying her business.

Alejandrina's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: to buy rice, eggs, flour, beans, etc

loans.name: Cenia Haydee

texts.es:
Cenia, tiene 37 años de edad, reside en Concepción Batres departamento de Usulután, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de tortillas,  este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de su hermana y su esposo, su horario de venta es de 9:00am a 2:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, esta compra le permitirá tener lo necesario para trabajar y aumentar su producción mejorando su atención a los clientes.
Su aspiración es ampliar la tortillería, tener más clientes, e ir prosperando junto a su familia, ofreciendo a sus hijos una mejor condición para el futuro.
texts.en:
Cenia,37 years old, lives with her husband and children in Concepcion Batres in the department of Usultan. She works selling tortillas, a business that she began with the help of her sister and her husband. She sells tortillas between the hours of 9:00am and 2:00pm.
Cenia is currently applying for a loan to buy corn and firewood; this purchase will allow her to have the necssary materials to work and increase her production, improving her service to her customers.
Her goal is to expand her tortilla business, have more customer, and prosper along with her family, offering her children better conditions for their future.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Valentin Eusebio

texts.es:
Valentín de 46 años, es un hombre inspirado en salir adelante que trabaja en un restaurant que esta el Malecón llamado El túnel del Malecón.

Labora como mesero en horarios rotativos de 8 horas diarias. El es soltero no tiene cargas familias todavía. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de adecuar su vivienda como cemento, arena, bloques y con esto desea tener una vida sana y estable.
texts.en: Valentín, 46, is a man who is inspired to succeed in his work at the Malecón Tunnel Restaurant which is located in Malecón.  He works as a waiter in rotating 8-hour daily shifts. He is  single has no family to care for yet. He wants to use the loan to buy construction materials to finish updating his home with cement, sand, and blocks, which will allow him a healthy and stable life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and blocks

loans.name: Kadidja

texts.fr: Agée de 33ans, Mme Kadidja  est une jeune dame dynamique qui aime faire le commerce. Elle est mariée à un technicien et a 02 enfants en charge. Elle se donne à cette activité (vente de produits de beauté, pagnes, mèches) depuis 2000. Elle vend à toutes personnes, s’approvisionne à Lomé, à Cotonou (Capitale du Bénin) et revend dans sa boutique à Djidjolé.  Ce prêt lui servira à acheter 04 cartons de produits de beauté,  02 cartons de mèches et 04 pièces de pagnes pour revendre afin de satisfaire ses clients pour avoir de bénéfices.
texts.en: Kadidia is a dynamic young woman of 33 years old who likes trading. She is married to a technician and has two children in her care. She has devoted herself to this business (the sale of beauty products, pieces of highly colourful fabric known as "pagnes" and hair extensions) since 2000. She sells to all sorts of people, gets her supplies in Lomé and Cotonou (the economic capital of Benin) and resells them in her shop in Djidolé. This loan will be used to buy four cartons of beauty products, two cartons of hair extensions and four pieces of "pagne" fabric, in order to satisfy customer demand and make money.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, hair extensions and "pagnes"

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz is 50 years old and is married with two children.  Six years ago he started his business selling cell phones.  He believes that this business is profitable and the generated income allows him to support his family.

However, Eyvaz thinks that it is expensive to purchase cell phones locally and that he will save money if he purchases the goods in another city.  With this purpose in mind, he requests a loan of 800 AZN.

Eyvaz is grateful to everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase more invemtories for the shop

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal los Claveles, tiene 35 años es madre soltera con un hijo de 15 años. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc., para surtir su mercadería.
Decidió abrir sus tienda para ayudarse con los gastos de su hijo. Le gusta FINCA Perú, por los préstamos que recibe de su Banco Comunal en FINCA, aprendió a ser independiente, los valores, a seguir adelante,  ahorrar, como invertir su dinero pasa momentos de distracción con las socias de su banco. Su sueño es que su hijo sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the communal bank "Los Claveles". She is 35 years old and the single mother of a 15-year old son. She has a grocery store and the loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of grocery products such as: rice, sugar, pastas, milk, etc, to supply her inventory.

She decided to open her store to cover her son's expenses. She appreciates Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for the loans that she receives through her Finca communal bank. She learned to become independent, to adopt values, to move forward, to save money, and how to invest her money. She is entertained by the time she spends with the other members of the bank. Her dream is for her son to have a successful career.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, pasta, and milk

loans.name: Karin Erica

texts.es: La señora Karin  se dedica a venta de cosméticos desde hace 5 años labor que realiza con la ayuda de su familia ella vende cosméticos por catalogo de distintas empresas muy reconocidas en el ámbito de la belleza, ofrece sus productos a amistades, oficinas, y por su zona ya que ella es una persona muy conocida en el área, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en  incrementar el capital de trabajo comprando mercadería que se encuentra en promoción y después ofrecerla un poco mas caro y así obtener mas ganancias, es un apersona joven con ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Karin has been selling cosmetics for five years, something that she does with the help of her family. She sells cosmetics by catalog through highly recognized beauty companies. She offers her products to friends, office workers, and others in her area because she is very well known around there. The money from the loan will be used to increase working capital and purchase merchandise that she finds on sale and can later sell at a slightly higher price to earn more money. She is a young person with dreams of succeeding. She is grateful to this organization for the support it provides.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, aged 28, is a single mother of three children. She makes and sells washing detergent. She has been in this business for seven years and earns a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

This is Sarah’s third loan term with KADET LTD. She has repaid her previous loans successfully. She will use the funds to buy the ingredients for making the detergent that she sells.

Sarah hopes to educate her children and be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for making the detergent that she sells.

loans.name: Ever Jose

texts.es:
Ever esta casado  y hombre honesto, su esposa es costurera y sus hijos están estudiando. Su proyecto es seguir mejorando la infraestructura de la vivienda. Para ofreciéndole a sus hijos mayor comodidad. Desde  hace tiempo trabajar en una empresa privada  El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, láminas de zinc, golosas, perlines entre otros para cambiar el techo y repellar las paredes de la casa. 

Agradece a la institución por el apoyo al desarrollo  de mejorar su nivel de vida y a la seguridad de su familia.
texts.en:
Ever is married and is an honest man, and his wife works as a dressmaker, and their children are in school.  HIs project is to continue making improvements on the infrastructure of his home to provide his children with greater comfort. For a while he has worked for a private company.  This loan will be used to buy construction materials such as: cement, sand, corrugated metal roofing material, beams, etc. to change the roof and plaster the walls of the house.

He is grateful to the institution for the support  to help him improve his living standard and his family's safety.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to put on a new roof.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen is 35 years of age and married. Her husband is a laborer by profession. She is the mother of three children. Her eldest son is also a laborer.  Her remaining two children stay at home. Due to financial reasons, she couldn’t educate her children. 

Shaheen is a very active lady and performs her household duties very well. She also has a buffalo at home. She sells its milk to her community clients. She is very fair in her rates and has a good number of clients in her area due to the quality of milk she provides to them. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo, which will allow her to sell a larger quantity of milk and increase her profits. She hopes that after the loan investment, her business will grow and increase her income, which will allow her family to have a better standard of living. 
 
She is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shaheen.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Fransmar

texts.en:
Fransmar is 48 years old and married, having two children. She is engaged in water refilling, and is a soya milk vendor and representative of organic fertilizer. She has managed her milk sales for two years and three years for her water refilling business. She is grateful because she is able to earn about P10,000 monthly in her water refilling business and P15,000 a month in her milk sales.She uses her profit for the payment of electric bills and some amounts go to their daily needs.

She would like to purchase a bigger machine for alkaline water refilling and a soya maker someday but due to insufficient funds she can not afford it. In this regard, she would like to ask for additional capital amounting to P25,000. That will be used to buy bottles of soya milk, gallons of alkaline water and organic fertilizer for her  retailing business. Through improving her soya milk production, water refilling and organic fertilizer sales her dreams will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to buy bottles of soya milk, gallons of alkaline water, and organic fertilizer for  retailing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 40 containers of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and to expand his poultry enclosure.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: Pastora mujer trabajadora, emprendedora de profesión costurera, su hijo estudia, su esposo jubilado. La mejora de su vivienda es unos de los planes para ofrecerle mayor comodidad a su familia. Con el préstamo comprara tela, hilos, abujas, encajes entre otros productos. Para ser utilizado en el mejoramiento de su negocio. Nuestra clienta elabora cobertores, delantales, cortinas, blusas, etc. Generándole mayores utilidades.
texts.en: Pastora is a hardworking woman of the sewing profession. Her son studies, and her husband is retired. One of her goals is to improve her home to be more comfortable for her family. With the loan she will buy fabric, thread, needles, lace, and other items to be used in improving her business, generating greater profits. She makes bedspreads, aprons, curtains, blouses, etc.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, needles, lace, and other supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She has a retail store based in her home where she earns about 2,000 PHP a week.

Teresita is also engaged to the piggery business, which she has been doing for two years.  She earns about 8,000 PHP for each pig she is able to sell. 

Teresita is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase groceries item such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, and other ingredients as well as buy feed and vaccine for her hogs to ensure good nutrition. 

Her family is her motivational guide in improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and allows her to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase groceries item such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, coffee, and other ingredients and feed and vaccine for her hogs

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is 48 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Dorotea has a curtain making business in the Philippines. Dorotea requested a loan of PHP 49,500 through NWTF to purchase more fabric for her curtain making business.

Dorotea has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Dorotea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric to make curtains

loans.name: C4817 Urukundo Group

texts.en:
Christine, a 24-year-old single businesswoman and leader of this group, called "Urukundo" in the local language, has been selling charcoal for about a year, and has one employee to help her. She works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. every day. She is the first woman on the left in the picture.

Christine and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses by buying more sacks of charcoal to sell. With the new profits arising from the loan, they hope to satisfy their customers and save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.
